story:
A t-shirt that captures all that we love about outdoor adventure

Think back to those last joy-filled days spent outside doing what you love - maybe it's climbing, hiking, camping, or just enjoying the wonder of the outdoors.

As hikers, climbers, and outdoor-lovers, we wanted to capture the stoke of those adventures we all stay up late at night dreaming about.

Our "Press On" tee is inspired by joy-filled days in the mountains. 

 

 

Why

Granite Creek started with some pretty incredible outdoor trips. Think campfires, rushing mountain rivers, the smell of wildflowers and pine trees in the spring, mountain sunsets, laughter over camp stories with friends, dreaming about life and adventure, and lots of coffee. Hiking, camping, rock climbing, fly fishing, or even just a short hammocking session with some friends - it was pretty darn fun. But they weren't particularly expensive or exotic or physically impressive - most were simply anchored by a few good buddies, a pile of mismatched gear, and a fierce love and desire to be outside and explore wild places.

These trips and places (whether the mountains in general or a specific campsite or river) won a fierce love in our hearts. Most days we weren't outside, we'd dream about when we could go back - the next trip that would take a bold and warm place in our hearts.

So why not try to capture a bit of that stoke and memory and put it on coffee gear?

 

 

That started a design mission for Kyle Ellefson and Conner Kranz, two rock climbers and creatives from Minnesota who spend too much time drinking coffee and looking at topo maps.

Our designs and gear are a small reminder of the things we love (coffee, adventure, and wild places) and why they’re so important.

So when you’re making that morning cup of coffee, when you’re far away from that place, you’ll be reminded of that stoke and the warm adventures that fuel it.

 

 

Good Causes + Good Gear

Lots of kids never have the opportunity to experience outdoor adventure. That's why 5% of the profits for this tee go to a non-profit that takes kids on wilderness trips. So when you get our gear, you're spreading good vibes all around. 

Super comfy. Rad design.

Nothing complicated, just a super soft and comfortable triblend tee. Oh, and a sick graphic designed by Granite Creek's Kyle Ellefson to keep you psyched on the mountains...

  • Unisex design
  • 50% poly, 25% cotton, 25% rayon
  • No sweatshops
  • Super comfy triblend

Size chart (from t-shirt manufacturer Bella + Canvas):

 

 

Keep the stoke high

We're doing a limited run of these t's. Like warm winter days, they won't last long. Get it while ya still can!

caution: this t-shirt may inspire obsessive trip planning, winter camping, rock climbing, daydreams, compulsive fly fishing, thru-hikes, and yoga. Wear responsibly and provide fair warning to friends.

story:
Short Summary

San Antonio Neighbors Helping Neighbors needs your help to save 1123 West French Place from demolition and ensure our good neighbor Miguel "Mike" Calzada and his wife Guadalupe live happily ever after in their home of 50 years.

Like many Americans the Calzada's have been set back by health problems and the associated medical bills. Mike suffered a widow maker heart attack and Guadalupe is on the transplant list for a liver. The Calzada's moved into 1123 West French Place 50 years ago, raised their children there, and have performed countless acts of selfless kindness for our community over those years.

Your contribution will fix the foundation, roof, lead paint abatement issues, electrical, plumbing, and paint - essentially completely restoring 1123 West French Place.  We have contractors pledged to work at discount rates and a large team of volunteers which is allowing us to spend 100% of the donations raised on essential systems and materials. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal of 25k pays for foundation work.

20k more provides for the roof.

20k more abates the lead paint.

15k more pays for the electrical.

15k more pays for plumbing, paint and other small projects.

All donations are made to San Antonio Alternative Housing Corporation, a local 501(c)(3), that has graciously agreed to assist us.

MaGuffin Content (www.MaGuffinContent.com), a local company, designed all of our perks pro bono and we are confident they will surpass your expectations.

$5 Contribution receives our sincere thanks, a place on the wall of gratitude at our web site, and regular updates as we work save 1123 West French Place.

$25 Contribution receives our sincere thanks, a place on the wall of gratitude at our web site, regular updates as we work to save 1123 West French Place from demolition, and an invitation to the Jamboree. The Jamboree will be a pot luck plus party held at 1123 West French Place once work is complete. We'll provide a tasty main course, a couple of beers or glasses of fine plonk and mineral water to wash it down and have tables prepared for the delicious creations you bring to share.

$50 Contribution receives a Team Armi 'Dillo T custom designed by MaGuffin Content just for this campaign. The Team Armi 'Dillo T is the must have Alamo City fashion item of 2015. This perk includes our sincere thanks, a place on the wall of gratitude on our web site, regular updates as we save 1123 West French Place from demolition, an invitation the Jamboree, and the Team Armi 'Dillo T-shirt in your choice of Lady's Cut or Men's Fit.


$100 Contribution receives everything the $50 dollar perk does, but adds the custom Armi 'Dillo nail apron - perfect to wear while helping save 1123 WestFrench Place.


$150 Contribution includes everything from the $100 dollar level with the addition of a custom Team Armi 'Dillo tote bag.


$250 Contribution includes everything from the $150 level with the addition of a custom embroidered Team Armi 'Dillo polo shirt. Perfect for casual Fridays, date nights, golf outings, etc. Sport your 'Dillo and show your support in style!

$500 Contribution includes everything from the $250 level with the addition of a custom made 24" by 24" stepping stone that will be inscribed with your message and placed at 1123 West French Place. The Team Armi 'Dillo gear will all ship out in September, but since the stepping stones will be made individually, your first opportunity to view your stone in person will most likely be during the Jamboree unless you volunteer at 1123 West French Place during the restoration.


During the fulfillment phase, we will ask you to provide four lines of text to fit along the outer edges of the stepping stone.

We reserve the right of refusal of any stepping stone order found to be inappropriate.  Please no profanity, discriminatory or inappropriate messages. Please do not refer to an individual's or group's sex, race, color, religious creed, national origin, age, or physical handicap. Other than that, please surprise and inspire us with your creative thoughts.

When you sponsor a stepping stone, your payment does not entitle you to receive a stepping stone, but rather is a charitable contribution. For each contribution, a personalized stepping stone will be placed at 1123 West French Place.


Risks & Challenges

1123 West French Place has been completely evaluated by an architect and a structural engineer. We know exactly what needs to be done and how to do it. All we need now is the money to make it happen.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable at this time to contribute, you can still assist:

Please...

  • Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Indiegogo has tools which make sharing on facebook, twitter, etc a snap!
  • Volunteer and help us save 1123 West French. The third work party will be scheduled after the roof is complete in September. Please email bob@SANeighborsHelpingNeighbors.org for more information on volunteering.

story:
Our Cause:

A group of Ramapo College students and I went down to Union Beach and Keyport, NJ to help with the rebuilding of the Jersey Shore. While we were there we captured some footage of the most devasted parts of the area and decided to make a documentary in hopes to show the rest of the world how destructive Hurricane Sandy really was.

The hurricane washed away the natives' homes, memories, and their lives. All forms of donations are welcomed, but the victims of Hurricane Sandy need money, as many have to rebuild from the ground up!  

 

What you can do to help!

All the money collected will go directly to the Hurricane Sandy Relief Fund organized by Governor Christie. The proceeds will go towards rebuiliding homes, collecting food and neccessities, and hopefully a quick rebuild of our beloved shores.

 

There are still other ways you can help!!! There are shelters and clothing drives scattered throughout South Jersey! Take some time out of your day to drop off a bag of clothes, cook a warm meal for a family that has no stove, or donate your time to help clean up. Together we can rebuild our shores. We are Jersey Strong.

story:
Help Troop 303 Replace Stolen Gear


Hi folks.  My name is Phil and I'm a 42 year old local Tampa small business owner and father of an 8 year old scout and 5 year old soon-to-be-scout.  I know how hard these guys work to raise funds for the gear they use all year.  When it is stolen in the blink of an eye, it is disheartening.

Rest assured that all funds raised will be given to the scouts to replace the gear that was stolen.  

For the full story about what happened, read the article on TBO.com:

http://www2.tbo.com/news/news/2012/jul/08/1/lakewood-ranch-scout-troop-victimized-by-thieves-ar-426674/

Im hoping the community steps up to the plate with a donation.  Let's show these scouts who give so much of their time to the community that bumps along the road are common and with a little help, any problem can be overcome.


I know that times are tough and our area has been hit particularly hard.  Anything you can give will be greatly appreciated. 

Scouts are taught to make best use of what little they have so any contribution, large or small, will help these kids out.

Thanks for your support!

.

​Unstoppable wheelchair luggage features a specially developed bracket to connect the 87L gear bag to a wheelchair.  Please see our compatibility guide for more details. http://phoenixinstinct.com/full-details


EASY TO HOOK UP

FREEDOM OF MOVEMENT
WON'T TIP YOUR CHAIR BACK EVEN WHEN FULLY LOADED

 

 

 

 

Off The back of this social media video it became clear wether walking or rolling there was a lot of interest in Unstoppable luggage. We felt the best way to fulfil the interest was by opening an opportunity to pre-order.

 

Production of our first large volume run is now complete and will soon be with us for shipping to customers.

We are confident we can ship all rewards by the end of June 2017.

story:
Bill Price (L d'Hon) in his 100th year, D-Day Veteran his 'wish list' is to go sailing from Australia to UK via the Panama Canal. It would be great to honour him with your support and join him on his tribute journey.

' Tribute trip by Veteran Gunner'

Bill Price (L d'Hon) is a Normandy Veteran in his 100th year, looks to celebrate his 100th year by sailing on the P&O ship Aurora, from Sydney to Southampton, which includes the Panama Canal. Bill was born in1914, it is also the 100th Anniversary of WWI, and the 100th anniversary of the opening of the Panama Canal. 

  • Celebrate his 100th Year born 1914
  • Commemorate the Anniversary of WWI 1914
  • Celebrate Opening Panama Canal 1914
  • 'Trigger' Bill served on a sunken ship forming the breakwater Mulberry harbour at Gold Beach at D-Day. He manned the anti aircraft artillery on board the ship Innerton.

At this point

We are working towards the securing our cabin, as it is a popular time for families returning to the UK from Australia. We offer personal photo postcards, and regular video updates, with exciting memories for us both.

We need another £500 towards this, as we have already started fundraising. The trip is in March 2015  with P&O on the Aurora.

1) YouTube: Bill marching with Surrey Branch Normandy Veterans 70th Anniversary in Arromanches  6 June 2014 early morning service  http://youtu.be/cdXixMFOwM0

2) Youtube: Bill marching 65th Anniversary Zutphen Holland, watch for Bill's hand wave early in the parade. http://youtu.be/6MaIe9O2n-E

http://youtu.be/shWrzvNGLdw  Panama Canal

Bill was known as 'Trigger' has he was considered by his artillery mates in the Army as being fast on the 'trigger'!. He still moves around at a cracking pace today.  

We will send friends updates

We will send postcards, video emails updates he loves listening to the song 'we are sailing'! Bill is truly amazing, is a great story teller, and loves meeting people and travelling. We will tell you about the people we meet and the ports of call, with lots of private pics and tweets.

Everyone can contribute 

Everyone can contribute or ask questions, and read about his adventures. This would start prior to our departure from Sydney! For my part, Helen loves taking photos and videos and will create the fun clips of us on the journey.

Prior to departure readings and updates

Prior to our departure in the month of January you will start receiving poetry readings from WWII and 'letters from D-Day' personal letters written home, and tributes to D-Day Piper Bill Millin.

For example this poem by Second World War poet John Jarmain, read by WW2 veteran Capt Robert Day.       http://youtu.be/Qu8uAJ_7VQg

ebook 'If I Don't Come Home'

These readings are a tribute to the lives and loves of people separated by war. We were also inspired by the ebook written by Capt Alastair Bannerman 'If I Don't Come Home' D-Day Letters from WWII.

Capt Bannerman, of the 2nd Battalion of the Royal Warwickshire Regiment, is due to lead his men ashore as part of the massive assault by the Allies on the Normandy beaches. Three days before D-Day, not knowing exactly what lies ahead, he pens a letter which becomes part of a journal, outlining his emotions to his wife Elizabeth: “From now onwards until D-Day plus One, I shall not get any letters from you… This morning this made me feel quite desperate… I felt a little empty. I am waiting so impatiently for news from you of yourself and my small sons, more than ever before in my life I am longing for you and if I am not able to send any letters at least I can write what I have to say in this little book and so express my emotions.”

Bill Price joined the Territorial Army in 1938 at the White City London. Serving with the Royal Engineers at the start of the war, he was transfered to the Royal Navy as part of the Channel crossing in convoy on the 5,000 tonne merchant ship Innerton one of the first pontoons to be holed and sunk on D-Day+1. This was one for the first ships sunk to form the floating Mulberry Harbour breakwater of Arromanches-les-Bains for the following invasion of Operation Overlord the D-Day landing. Bill served as anti-aircraft artillery and known as being known as 'Trigger'.

Tributes to D-Day Piper Bill Millin

Also series of youtube tributes to the D-Day piper Bill Millin. William "Bill" Millin (14 July 1922 – 17 August 2010), commonly known as Piper Bill, was personal piper to Simon Fraser, 15th Lord Lovat, commander of 1 Special Service Brigade at D-Day. Bill featured as the piper in the Normandy landing film 'The Longest Day'.

We were in Piper Bill Millin's home town Dawlish, this year. It is a seaside town whose railway runs along the ocean front, and was recently devestated by the powerful winter storms. We stayed on the seafront William "Bill" Price recalled happy memories of cycling from London to Dawlish in 1933 with three friends and staying at the old coast guard houses under the railway line. We also visted the wonderful local museum which features Bill's life in Dawlish. In June 2014 we visited Sword Beach in Normandy and paid tribute to the  remembrance  statue. YouTube: http://youtu.be/B4WZwz2C72M

 Bill and Helen at the D-Day Piper statue in Normandy June 2014. 

Quote from Bill "I would love to sail on from Sydney to Southampton in March 2015 before I get too old to travel, and to go through the Panama Canal, its a engineering marvel, a fabulous experience."

The Panama canal is 48 miles long, opened in 1914, the year of his birth, by President Woodrow Wilson, and it takes a 8-10 hours journey from Atlantic to the Pacific. Used during WWII for the US Military to restore its Pacific fleet. It plays a very important part in international shipping.

Risks & Challenges

Time is our delivering angel and also a foreboding angel. As Bills dearest wish is to do this, his excellent health should pose no problems. If Bill is no able to use the funds they will be donated in his memory to a disabled 
serviceperson through The Not Forgotten Association. http://www.nfassociation.org 
Bill is well known to this Association and has visited their head office in London. The patron is Princess Anne (portrait painted by Helen hangs in their office), Bill has met HRH at Buckingham Palace at various times.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share this link to those who would like to help a hero!

story:
A super comfortable, water-resistant day pack with full size shoulder straps and back support that can hold up to 18 L of volume, but that also folds down to smaller than a can. Simply remove the back and strap system from your travel pack and place it onto the day pack, and you’re ready to go.

 

After our successful Kickstarter campaign for the TREXAD Air Pack, we immediately set out to tackle our next project. Our goal was to create an awesome travel pack that everyone would love. We couldn’t think of a better way to do it than to ask our backers and supporters for their advice.

The features kept rolling in. They all sounded so great that we decided, “instead of prioritizing, let’s include EVERYTHING.”

And that’s exactly what we did.

We’re back this time with a feature-rich travel pack created totally by the crowd. You asked for it, we included it. Meet TREXAD Mundo.

 

Tross is a data driven Crowdfunding company

story:
To all the guys out there — how many times have you arrived on a business trip only to discover you don't have your favorite grooming product? Maybe it's your moisturizer, hair pomade, body wash or even your toothbrush.

Let's start at the problem way before you even leave home.

We all need to travel with three ounces or less — so what are your options?

You can scour the bottom a drugstore bin, for let's face it, low-quality brands. You could piece together a dopp kit from multiple websites. You could tediously fill tiny bottles with your favorite products. Or, you could be forced to stock up at the airport or hotel gift shop, and on top of not getting exactly what you want, you'll fork over a small fortune.

You're busy. And we're guessing one of the last things you want to spend time on is sourcing grooming products for your travels. You need less hassle and more convenience.

That's where we come in — Boxed Basics is a one-stop-shop for TSA-compliant and travel-ready grooming products. Want your favorite indie brand in 3 ounces? We have it. Need your high-end cologne to make it through security? We've got you covered. Always forgetting your trusted razor? Guess what? We've got that too.

Not only do we carry a wide selection of grooming products — we ship directly to your door or destination.

So for that next business trip, weekender, road trip or workout session — just throw our kit in your bag and go.

And given the state of the world right now, we know that the way we travel has changed forever. Not only does Boxed Basics drastically reduce a product's touch points, each kit will be packed with safety and hygiene as a top priority.

We believe the future of travel is now and we hope you'll hop on board with us.
story_txt: To all the guys out there — how many times have you arrived on a business trip only to discover you don't have your favorite grooming product? Maybe it's your moisturizer, hair pomade, body wash or even your toothbrush.Let's start at the problem way before you even leave home.We all need to travel with three ounces or less — so what are your options?You can scour the bottom a drugstore bin, for let's face it, low-quality brands. You could piece together a dopp kit from multiple websites. You could tediously fill tiny bottles with your favorite products. Or, you could be forced to stock up at the airport or hotel gift shop, and on top of not getting exactly what you want, you'll fork over a small fortune.You're busy. And we're guessing one of the last things you want to spend time on is sourcing grooming products for your travels. You need less hassle and more convenience.That's where we come in — Boxed Basics is a one-stop-shop for TSA-compliant and travel-ready grooming products. Want your favorite indie brand in 3 ounces? We have it. Need your high-end cologne to make it through security? We've got you covered. Always forgetting your trusted razor? Guess what? We've got that too.Not only do we carry a wide selection of grooming products — we ship directly to your door or destination.So for that next business trip, weekender, road trip or workout session — just throw our kit in your bag and go.And given the state of the world right now, we know that the way we travel has changed forever. Not only does Boxed Basics drastically reduce a product's touch points, each kit will be packed with safety and hygiene as a top priority.We believe the future of travel is now and we hope you'll hop on board with us.

story:
Short Summary

Hello and welcome to our funding page for the Ignite to Light USA Mission Road Trip. We are a group of young people currently studying the methods Christ used to teach including the health principles and to meet the needs of humanity.

Although we are from all over the world our mission is united and simple. We aim to take the light of medical missionary work to a starving US population--a land that eats for entertainment but is dying of preventable diseases.

We will ignite a revival for a closer connection to the "light of the world," Jesus Christ. Through interactive workshops and demonstrations we will show the practicality of the gospel and how the tool of health can be used to initiate the spread of the word of Christ's love to dying American communities.

There are needs all over the world, but our hearts--and bodies--are in the USA. We trust that you see the necessity of supporting us in this work.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goal is $15,000. This will purchase a used van, one large enough to hold us five plus luggage, food, books, etc and late model enough to make it to the West coast and back. Our other expenses include:

-Purchasing education materials- class handouts, manuals, books, demonstration supplies, etc

-Purchasing gas along the trip which will be around $1200 in total.

-Purchasing a camera to use to document our expericences on the trip

-Paying for KOA's and camping/lodging expenses

-Paying for food

 

We are prepared to give small tokens as gratitude to our donors for their generosity. These tokens will be anything from a postcard from the various states, to a DVD set of health presentations, to healthy option cookbooks, to a Skype interview with the Ignite To Light team, to a 25% discount for a relaxing and educational 11-day Lifestyle Session here at the Wildwood campus!

 

In the event that we don't reach our goal the donations will not go to waste. They will be used instead to travel to as many states as the funds allow. All hope will not be lost the mission trip will move forward!

 

The Impact

We are partnering with a ministry called LIGHT. LIGHT trains lay men and women to be medical evangelists, like Christ, and then to teach what they have learned with the end goal of spreading God's love to all mankind. LIGHT has done training in far reaching places of the world, bringing light to many dark parts of the globe. However, little has been done right here at home.

By your contributions we will be able to travel, educate and ignite a flame of enthusiasm for further training. This project is one of the first of its kind and is a pioneering endeavor. With God's guiding, our vision, and energy and your contributions this dream will soon become a reality for the Ignite To Light team and many waiting Americans.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at present, no worries here are other ways you can help this cause:

-Pray for us

-Recommend auto dealers, possible sponsors, auctions, rental services, camping sites, travel routes, et cetera to us by email: ignitetolight@gmail.com

-Share our funding site with frineds and family through the Indiegogo share tools!

-Liking our page on Facebook 

-Sending us your love by email, facebook, youtube or any of our other social media accounts.

-Subscribe to our YouTube channel

-Come out to one of our programs near you!

story:
Hello,
 
My name is Juliana Chiovitti.
I started racing go karts at the age of 5 after watching my brothers compete on our families race track in Sutton, Ontario, Canada.
 
By the time I turned 16, I turned "Pro" which means a had the opportunity to race all over the World; and earn a little bit of money.
 
I travelled across North America, Europe, Asia and Guyana doing what I loved; racing go karts, formula cars, GT cars; whatever I could get my hands on.
 
By the time I tested an Indy Car, I was fully out of funding.
 
Like a lot of drivers who ran out of money, I turned to Performance Driver Training in order to stay sharp and in the sport I love.
 
I'm lucky to say, I get paid to drive other peoples high-performance and exotic sports cars.
 
After a lot of work, I'm finally launching my own racing team, Hook-Up Motorsports.
 
As owner and driver of Hook-Up Motorsports, I will compete in select regional and national events in the Canadian Touring Car Championship.
 
I have a HUGE hurdle to climb as I'm making the switch from "formula cars" to "touring" cars, but I'm excited, motivated and passionate about this next chapter.
 
Here's the Plan:
 
The plan is to participate in multiple lapping and testing days, followed by (2) regional and (2) national races all held at Canadian Tire Motorsports Park, formally known as Mosport.
 
Our total budget for 2013 is $45000.00
This includes the lapping, testing, licensing fees, registration, tires, gas, multiple mechanics, race trailer, regional and pro races.

Everybody who contributes to our race team, whether it's $25 dollars or $10,000 or anything in between; will receive 1 year of exposure on our site.

If we do not reach our complete goal, our race team will continue to look for additional funding, BUT, we 100% will still take part in lapping and racing.

I guarantee all of our contributors will receive exposure on our company site for 1 year. So if you have a product or blog you'd like exposure for; we will help you.

Please no porn or adult sites.

I'd like to graciously thank everyone in advance for helping or even considering our Project.

This is a dream come true, and I'm taking you all along for the ride.

story:
Video By and For A Species That Can Do Better

​Contrary to common belief, independent filmmakers do not have an endless source of money. When they look at their ATM receipts they do not burst into glutenous laughter. And when their backpacks (containing expensive filmmaking equipment) get stolen they do not just call up the 'ol Suga Daddy for a paycheque.

Also contrary to common belief, they are not lonely bodies floating in the cut-throat world of the film industry. They have an army of supporters and fans who will not let a single act of deuchebaggary drag down their bank accounts.

Remember when one of your favourite filmmakers - JESSE FREESTON - had his backpack stolen last week? Remember how enraged you felt? Remember that kickass multiple-angle video he comprised from the CCTV cameras in Cafe Pi? Well, now you can put that rage to work.

HELP US GET JESSE HIS EQUIPMENT BACK!

In the off chance you don't know who Jesse is because this campaign went so viral you just heard about it in your hometown of Suva, Fiji Islands, he is the man who covered the Honduras five-year-long Coup D'etat, Cuba's Revolutionary Medicine, and Canada's dirty mining in El Salvador. He is the man who got punched in the face by a cop for his coverage of the G20 protests in Toronto, and still went on to make all these docs:jessefreeston.com/docs-2

It's no wonder he won 2nd place at the Cuban Hat Competition in the Montreal International Film Festival (RIDM) for his pitch of RESISTENCIA! The documentary that's going to revolutionize 2014. So in case that wasn't enough for you to fall in love with this trail blazing creature, here's something that will. This is Jesse Freeston's journalistic motto: video by and for a species that can do better.

story:
WHAT IS THE APOLLO BEACH NYE FIREWORKS SHOW?

Again this New Year's Eve, the Apollo Beach/South Shore business community is coming together to put on it’s second annual 2015 New Year's Eve fireworks show. Thanks to the shows corporate sponsors last year, we raised just shy of $30,000, which officially made this show the largest 2014 New Year's Eve fireworks display in the entire State of Florida! 

FACT: Last years Apollo Beach/South Shore NYE show actually beat out the City of Ft. Myers for the state's largest NYE fireworks display and was 3X the size of the Channelside/Tampa NYE show at the port. This event put the sleepy little town of Apollo Beach prominently on the regional stage and garnered a tremendous amount of media coverage. We have already raised more corporate money this year than we did last year, which means the 2015 show is going to be BIGGER & BETTER than before!


WHY DO WE DO THE FIREWORKS SHOW?

The Apollo Beach New Year's Eve fireworks show was created as a way for local business owners to give back to the community of Apollo Beach – which is the same community that these businesses are located in, and the same community which these businesses are supported by. This show was originally thought of as a ‘thank-you’ to the community from the sponsors who funded it. Last year, we never imagined in a million years that we would ever get the kind of support from the business community that we ended up receiving. Furthermore, we never expected that the ‘thanks’ would get turned around back onto us, but that’s exactly what happened. Here’s an example of one of the countless emails and messages that poured in after last years show: 

  • Patty Lemanski wrote, "The fireworks show last night was breathtaking. Thank you so much for allowing my family and this community to be a part of this New Year's celebration. When I looked over at my 12 year old standing there on the dock, and saw tears running down her face, I asked her if she was all right. She said that this was something she would remember for the rest of her life, it was so beautiful." 

So, this is why we do the fireworks show, and that’s what it is all about.


WHY ARE WE TEAMING UP WITH INDIEGOGO?

After the success of last years show, we had a lot of interest expressed from individuals and smaller businesses who wanted to help participate in sponsoring the next show, but weren't in a position to give the minimum required $500 corporate donation. Additionally, there were a lot of homeowner’s associations who wanted to participate collectively but couldn’t because of their association by-laws. Therefore, by partnering with Indiegogo, we have created a way for those of you who want to participate in this community-sponsored event to do so. The minimum donation through this site is just $1, so you can pick a donation level that works for you.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR?

Anything! No dollar amount is too small. EVERY SINGLE DOLLAR DONATED WILL GO DIRECTLY TOWARDS ADDITIONAL FIREWORKS TO MAKE THIS SHOW BIGGER AND BETTER. NOT A SINGLE PENNY WILL BE USED FOR MANAGEMENT FEES, PROCESSING FEES, SALARIES, ADMINISTRATIVE FEES, OR ANYTHING LIKE THAT.

We are also looking for you to spread the word for us. So, regardless of whether or not you choose to participate in helping us sponsor this year’s show; please plan on coming to the Apollo Beach area to see it. It’s free of charge to everyone, and it’s going to be absolutely spectacular. We promise you’ll be glad that you came.


WHAT TIME AND WHERE IS THE SHOW?

The show, which will be choreographed to music, will begin promptly at 12:00am midnight on January 1st (New Year's Eve). The fireworks will be shot off of a construction barge floating in the center of Bal Harbor, right off of beautiful Tampa Bay, in the middle of Apollo Beach. 

The spectacle will be visible to all of the 5,800 homes and businesses in the area, including those people not located directly on the water, and will be seen clear back to I-75, into Sun City, up to Riverview, and beyond. If you didn’t have the pleasure of seeing it last year, watch the full video here on Indiegogo, or ask anyone of the thousands of people who did. The best place to view the show are properties close to Bal Harbor - on the water - in Apollo Beach. There are several un-built, vacant properties, on Apollo Beach Boulevard that make for perfect viewing sites. Last year, there were house parties everywhere in the community – so a friend’s house in the area is also a perfect venue. Another great way to watch the show is from a boat. However, please be aware that the Marine Patrol and Coast Guard will be shutting Bal Harbor off from boat access (in and out) approximately 2 hours before the show and for 30 minutes after. Also, Circles Waterfront Restaurant (www.circleswaterfront.com) hosts a large-scale outdoor party from 6pm to 2am that is free. 


WHO ACTUALLY DOES THE SHOW?

New Year's Eve is right around the corner, and all the behind the scenes planning & permitting for the 2015 Apollo Beach/South Shore NYE fireworks show is well under way. Pyrotecnico, Inc. (www.pyrotecnico.com), is hands down the largest, most creative, and most experienced fireworks display company in the United States. They have been hired again this year to produce the State of Florida’s largest 2015 NYE fireworks show in, of all places, Apollo Beach! Pyrotecnico produces the fireworks shows for the City of New York, the City of New Orleans, the Buccaneers, the Yankees, and many of the casinos in Las Vegas – to name a few. Currently, they are in the process of securing permits from the Hillsborough County Sherriff’s Department, the Hillsborough County Fire Department, U.S. Homeland Security, the U.S. Coast Guard (because the show will be over navigable waters), and the Florida Marine Patrol (FFWCC). They are also in the process of hiring the Florida Marine Patrol and the U.S. Coast Guard to shut down Bal Harbor before and during the show, which is required by law. There is a tremendous amount of coordination and preplanning that goes into producing a show of this magnitude. This is a "City" - "Municipality" scaled show and the effort going into putting this all together is just as HUGE as the show itself!


WELL, JUST HOW BIG IS THE APOLLO BEACH SHOW?

To put the scale of this show into perspective and give you an idea of the MAGNITUDE of what we are doing; last year the City of Tampa spent $10,000 on their NYE show and $18,000 on their 4th of July show. Furthermore, the City of Ft. Myers spent $25,000 on their 2014 NYE show – a show that has long been the reigning largest NYE show in the State of Florida – until we came along! We spent nearly $30,000 on the Apollo Beach show last year, and we have already smashed last year’s corporate sponsorship record by raising over $30,000 so far, to date, for the 2015 show! 


WHO ARE THE SHOWS 2015 CORPORATE SPONSORS?

This event is only possible because of the generous support of our corporate sponsors. The sponsorships keep coming in, but so far, here’s the list…

2015 PREMIERE SPONSORS ($5,000 and UP)

  • Tampa Electric Company (TECO)
  • Circles Waterfront Restaurant

2015 PLATINUM SPONSORS ($2,000 and UP)

  • All Steel Buildings
  • Century 21 - Beggins Enterprises
  • Curry Law Group
  • Tampa General Hospital (TGH)

2015 GOLD LEVEL SPONSORS ($1,000 and UP)

  • All Crane of Florida
  • Andalucía Yacht Club
  • Dickman Realty
  • Don & Donna Granowicz
  • Island Marine Group
  • Lands End Marina
  • Master Purveyors
  • Service Works Roofing
  • Servpro – Johnigean Construction
  • Wells Fargo Insurance

2015 BRONZE LEVEL SPONSORS ($500 and UP)

  • BB&T Bank
  • Bella Casa
  • Bill Currie Ford
  • CCC Group
  • CRT Services
  • HE Building Solutions
  • The Kearney Family
  • Ricky’s

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR INTEREST IN OUR SHOW. PLEASE MAKE PLANS TO COME OUT ON NEW YEAR'S EVE WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILIES TO ENJOY THE FIREWORKS!!!

story:
MultiGrip is a new revolutionary multi-tool from the team that brought you the game-changing Disc Wallet products.

 

With pocket space at a premium, it’s important to get the most out of your multi-tool. Ideally, you want something that’s functional enough to be worth carrying, while still being easy to pocket and use.

 

The MultiGrip multitool embodies many core principles of Every Day Carry — utility, versatility, portability and weighs a mere 32g (1.1 ounces).

 

For quick fixes, tinkering, and other handy work, having a toolbox’s worth of functionality in a single pocketable tool is invaluable.

 

Portable and adventure-ready, the MultiGrip is ideal for the everyday carry community.

 

 

 

MultiGrip is made of durable and premium SUS 304 Stainless Steel featuring over 25 tool functions with each one of them providing precision-engineered multiple uses. 

 

304 stainless steel has excellent resistance to a wide range of atmospheric environments and many corrosive media. CNC machining is being applied, and the surface is bead blasted for a smooth finish. This method was selected to ensure that MultiGrip could withstand a lifetime of use.

 

MultiGrip was born after a long 1 year of designing, prototyping, and testing in different conditions by our fans worldwide. These iterations have been perfected to provide the features as follows.

 

 

The most widely used multi-tool feature, the bottle opener can open all types of caps in a second. Blending tradition with modern, the large grip area provides optimum comfort and makes it extremely easy to use.

 

 

 

MultiGrip features a new patent pending screwdriver tip that will fit a #2/3 Slotted, #2 Square Drive, #2/3 Phillips, and #2/3 Combinations (Phillips/Slotted or Phillips/Square) screw all in one bit. 

 

With so many combinations in one body, the MultiGrip caters all types of screw types. 

 

 

 

 

 

MultiGrip features a new patent pending closed wrench where it has combined both Metric and Imperial sizes into one. 

 

All of the dimensions are designed proportionally to keep it strong and at a minimum weight for adequate torque on hex nuts and bolts.

 

The Imperial side fits 5/16, 3/8, 7/16 and 1/2 inch hex sizes. 

 

The Metric side fits M8 (13mm), M7 (11mm), M6 (10mm) and M5 (8mm) hex sizes.

 

 

 

 

 

MultiGrip features a standard 1/4" inch hex drive pocket that will fit any desired bit. 

 

Whether you need allen head through to torx, the MultiGrip holds any standard 1/4” hex drive with the perfect fit and rotation to ensure it moves with you. 

 

 

 

 

MultiGrip allows you to open cans of paint of multiple sizes with ease. 

 

The angled edge of the tip is designed to properly fit under the lid lip to pry the can open. 

 

 

 

MultiGrip allows you to open boxes of multiple sizes and materials with ease.

 

 

 

MultiGrip allows you to access and remove batteries with ease.

 

 

 

MultiGrip allows you to open cans of multiple sizes and materials with ease. 

 

 

 

MultiGrip is equipped with a handy beveled inner edge that provides a sharp wedge that will strip many various sizes of wires. 

 

 

 

MultiGrip is equipped with a scoring tip that functions as a staple pry. Push-style mechanism lifts staples easily without tearing paper.  

 

 

 

MultiGrip is equipped with a scoring tip that tears open packages with ease. 

 

 

 

MultiGrip has a linear edge file with small beveled edges that can be used to file and smooth all surfaces including wood, metal, plastic and many more. 

 

 

 

MultiGrip is equipped with a letter opener that slides through all envelopes easily.

 

 

 

MultiGrip allows you to easily split pills with minimum effort.

 

 

 

MultiGrip features a serrated edge to cut multiple materials including rope, thread, fishing line, lace and many more. The serrated edge is TSA compliant and we have carried the MultiGrip in all commercial and international flights with ease.

 

 

 

 

MultiGrip is equipped with a scraper to remove even the toughest materials. Rugged Construction ensures superior wear tolerance and life.

 

 

 

MultiGrip allows you to scratch your tickets instantly without losing your fingernails.

 

 

 

MultiGrip's tape slitter tab makes opening tapes fast and easy.

 

 

 

MultiGrip features a handy 2 cm / 20mm / 0.78 inches ruler which is versatile for marking screws, bolts, and paperwork.

 

 

 

MultiGrip features a keyring holder to easily carry it anywhere on the go.

 

 

 

MultiGrip features a 3.2/3.3mm (0.127 inches) standard open spoke wrench that easily fits in between bike wheel spokes to tighten or loosen the spokes. Complimenting features include handy screwdriver bit and multi wrenches.

 

Be always prepared for your biking adventures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

MultiGrip was developed using an iterative design process. Designs were first sketched and then built in CAD to create prototypes for 3D printing. 

 

 

MultiGrip prototypes were initially 3D printed in plastic and metal, then measured, tested, and refined through an iterative process, where changes and modifications through user feedback were made until every detail performed its job perfectly.

 

 

The initial prototype in the picture above was created with a process called DMLS (Direct Metal Laser Sintering), which is basically 3D printing metal, but is not ideal for mass production as it would be too expensive to produce even in high volumes ($550 for the cost of one).

 

After a lot of research, communication, and meetings with many manufacturers across the USA over the last 1 year, we have selected a manufacturing method for high volume stainless steel parts called Computer Numerical Control (CNC Machining). 

 

Under CNC Machining, machine tools function through numerical control. 

 

A computer program is customized for an object and the machines are programmed with CNC machining language (called G-code) that essentially controls all features like feed rate, coordination, location, and speeds. 

 

With CNC machining, the computer can control exact positioning and velocity. 

 

 

MultiGrip is a complex multitool, that is lightweight and requires precise machining and we are excited to manufacture it for you. 

 

 

 

After various iterations, these are the final designs for the packaging. 

 

Each feature is clearly prominent which makes MultiGrip a new revolutionary EDC modern multi-tool featuring over 25+ tools in solid Stainless Steel.

 

 

 

 

 

Founded in 2016, Disc is a modern accessories brand working out of San Francisco to inspire the everyday modern world looking for accessibility and freedom in their daily essentials.

 

 

I'm Ankit, the creator of MultiGrip and founder of Disc. My whole life I’ve been an entrepreneur and am obsessed with building unique products in improving everyday carry lives, exceeding customer experiences and making the people in my life smile.

 

In 2016 we launched the original Disc Wallet, in early 2017 we launched the Disc Passport Wallet, in late 2017 we launched the Disc Hero Wallet. All of these past products are available at discwallets.com

 

Here are just some of what our genuine customers have been saying about all our products so far:

 

 

Our customers reached out to us in designing unique multitools to carry every day that is functional, uniquely designed, practical and flexible enough to be used instantly on the go. 

 

 

Our team is made up of curiously minded designers, adventurers looking to create high-quality gear for you. 

 

By working on the products for over 1 year, we have designed the ultimate multi-tool.

 

MultiGrip has become an essential companion to our everyday carry and we can't wait to share it with you!  

 

On our previously funded campaigns, we have shipped anywhere from 2 weeks to 1 month ahead of schedule and have planned on delivering on time with transparent communications throughout the development journey.

story:
How to get free "Safe Belt"?

It's quite simple! Once get through 200%, we'll send Safe Belt as  a gift! It's almost there!

 

What is PackChairX?

　 As photographers, we enjoy living in the moment. Looking through the lens, we’re able to appreciate the minute changes between light and shadow, between different hues in the color palette... Then, with one small press of the shutter, capture the beauty and proof of our authentic lives. We on the PackChair team are passionate about both travel and photography. It’s how we get through the Monday to Friday grind. But we’ve come to realize with experience, and as we’ve collected more and more specialized equipment, that life throws at us a lot of unexpected obstacles on our way to the photography site. Carrying one or more heavy bags of expensive equipment runs its risks. One heavy rain, one fall, or one thief could indeed cost us thousands of dollars, but more importantly, it ruins the whole experience. We shared this issue with others and found that many of our friends and colleagues face the same issue, that is, protecting their heavy valuable equipment while at the same time enjoying their outdoor experience. Over several years and countless trials, we’ve created a solution: PackChair X.

 

　In 2015, we launched PackChair, a backpack for short trips that also functions as a chair. After our first launch and getting feedback, in 2016 we launched a highly protective camera bag. Then, in 2017, we started thinking about what kind of bag could both protect our equipment and adapt itself to different types of outdoor journeys. Finally, we’ve arrived at PackChairX, a backpack that has the important qualities of our prior models, but also includes three more accessories to enhance a user’s varied needs. The ‘X’ in PackChairX stands for extra experience. This bag is going to exceed your expectations.

 

Take a look at PackChair X.

 　PackChair X is sturdy and durable. It’s made from high performance water resistant fabric, an aluminum alloy frame,YKK zippers, and magnetic buckles. All of which make for safe and convenient storage and accessibility.

Organizer Pocket 

　The organizer pocket is for storing your EDC essentials such as a charging cables, earbuds, memory cards, smart phones, etc. You can fix your items in place with an elastic band. This allows for the easy insertion and removal of items at a glance.

 

What make it so strong?

　PackChair X has a unique and patented frame made from the same aluminum alloy that is often used in aeronautics industries. Its frame gives a light-weight yet solid performance.

 

"PackCahir X will lift you up, Actually, PackChair X can lift up a car.”

Let's do this!!!

What's more, it shields against outside forces.

Let's see how strong the PackChair is!

 

Comfortable to Carry

    We’ve all experienced carrying a bunch of cumbersome luggage with us on a long trip. That’s why PackChair X has wide thick straps — to increase contact area with the body, in turn distributing weight evenly. PackChair offers you unconditional love with a firm and secure hug at all times.

 

 

Charge and Go

　USB and micro USB charging ports make charging your electronic devices quick and easy. No need to wait for one thing to charge before plugging in another.You can charge your phone and power bank simultaneously.

 

Fidlock Magnetic Buckle

　Fidlock, a modern and durable German brand, only requires one hand to pull open the buckle. Then, to rebuckle, lightly pull it back in place. It’s better than magic!

　On the strap of the backpack, Fidlock relieves weight from the zipper, and also acts as a second line of defense in preventing theft. In order to save time and make access smoother, we wanted to provide a buckle that can be used with your eyes closed.

 

Details

 

Functions of Accessories.

You never know what challenges life will bring next. PackChairX is the only bag you need.  

Removable Insert 

　A removable insert can either carry one DSLR camera and four lenses or two cameras and three lenses. Inside of the insert is a padded divider which allows you to configure the insert as you see fit.

 

Camera Bag S

　The camera bag s is perfect for casual photography. You can leave PackChair’s main body at home or in your vehicle and take the smaller lightweight camera bag to your shooting destination.

 

Fanny Pack

　Like the camera bag, you can also detach the fanny pack for on the go use. It’s suitable for a range of uses including photography or your everyday demands.

It also has fidlock SNAPs that attach to the main body of the backpack.

 

Safety Belt

　A child likes sitting on their parent’s shoulders not always because their feet hurt but because they want to explore the world from another point of view. The Safety Belt can be attached to the strap of the backpack to keep a child’s feet firmly in place, and since the top of the PackChair is cushioned, a child can sit safely and comfortably while getting an aerial view of their surroundings.

 

Perks

 

 

Dimensions Overview

Timeline

 

Risks & Challenges

　Our team has experienced three successful local Taiwan crowdfunding projects in the past few years. We’re no strangers in the crowdfunding world. Based off of our past experiences, we are confident in our design process and the ability of our manufacturers, who have amassed more than 30 years of experience, to produce quality backpacks. However, if we meet any problems in our process, we will immediately inform our backers.


Acts of God

　Since many of our backers are located internationally, we expect and are prepared to encounter packing, shipping, and customs issues. Please check in advance to see if your shipping address is on our list of countries (you can check list through making a perk while selecting country) we can ship to.

 

　In addition, Taiwan is located in what is referred to as “the ring of fire,” an area in the Pacific Ocean known for its frequent earthquakes and typhoons. Once in awhile, poor weather conditions put manufacturers behind schedule, in turn slowing down the production process. Again, if these circumstances occur, we will inform our backers ASAP. Rest assured, we’ll do everything we can to get PackChairX quickly and safely in your hands.

story:
Meet the Bivymok

We have developed a beautiful and simple single pole two-person tent to be used on the ground as a stand alone unit or with our unique suspension platform as a hammock tent.

Tent Up Front

On the ground the tent can be quickly staked and lifted with a single aluminum pole. It has a wide zippered entry at the front. The main attraction of this tent is its ability to submerge its occupants completely in nature by providing an unobstructed view of everything around you while keeping the bugs out. And if it looks like rain, the waterproofed rain fly can be easily added to maintain a dry hideaway.

Hammock in the Back

The tent is designed to attach to our suspension platform to give you the best of both worlds, all the shelter you need with all the advantages of sleeping in comfort, midair. Our hammock platform can easily hold 1000 lbs, which really means, it's not delicate. There is no need to fear getting in or out. Our unique design also does away with falling through, falling off or being tossed out! 

Advantages

It's easy to see how a suspended tent is the next evolution in sleeping outdoors, from those that are looking to add more terrain opportunities to their campsite to those that are just starting out. A Bivymok eases camp setup and nighttime anxiety. You'll think less about the ground and more about adventure.

Pockets are giving way to loops! Our looped ends in our suspension platform are where the versatility starts to show. With the many loops you have the flexibility to add what you want to your sleep fortress. You can hang your gear from them, use them to make micro positioning adjustments to your setup, attach them to other hangers to create super hammocks or gather them together for modified hangs. Loops are where it's at!

Features

We have a list of features underscored by quality. Our tent fabric is made of lightweight yet durable ripstop polyester. Both the bathtub floor of the tent and the entire rainfly have received a waterproof coating and have been taped at the seams to provide the tightest waterproof barrier between you and the elements. Our soft polyester mesh top is designed to keep the bugs completely out while you lay down and take in every view under the sky. It's a single aluminum pole tent which provides a quick setup. Aluminum stakes are provided for ground set up and straps and buckles help secure the tent to the platform for suspended camping.

Our suspension platform is where safety comes first. Every stitch becomes part of the overall design and versatility of the structure. The many bar-tacks provide function and redundant strength and the circular multi-directional stitching holds it all together reducing stress points. 

User Satisfaction

"Toughest, most versatile hammock on the market!" Tev K.
"Only way to hang!" Bernardine W.
"I was already an outdoorsman, but the Multimok revolutionized my relaxation!" David J.
"Hang up, or shut up." Brian P.

Industry Review

Fully Waterproofed

Extremely Dependable

 

 

Package Details

ALL-VIEW GROUND TENT | EARLY BIRD

ALL-VIEW GROUND TENT

ALL-VIEW GROUND TENT W/SOL PANEL RAINFLY

THE SUSPENSION PLATFORM W/MOD POINTS

TOTAL SUSPENSION PLATFORM W/STRAPS & CORDS

FLYING TENT CLUB

FLYING TENT CLUB x2

The Multimok Story

Multimok started out of a need for a bigger, better, stronger and more stable hammock. Whether you're on the beach, deep in the mountains or at the park, there is nothing better than hovering above the earth a bit as you soak it all in. There is also nothing worse than falling out of the sky. Removing the 'risk' from the whole hammock experience was one of the main goals. That was way back in 2016.

Aside from the safety benefit, the original Multimok solved other issues, too! The design removed all the complications of hanging a hammock 'just right' for the 'perfect lay'. It provided various set up options for a flat lay and works for back, side or stomach sleepers.

We did that by creating a modular suspension platform ready to hold 1000lbs of whatever you want to put into it. Our platform is designed around comfort and safety.

By adding modularity to our system it becomes whatever you want it to.

Camp Multimok

From our first KickStarter there are Multimok'rs all around the globe.

Shipping

We are shipping to the US for this campaign so that we can provide the best possible shipping price and faster service. There are shipping options for other countries on our website at https://gear.multimok.com

FAQ

*When will it ship?
Now! We are currently shipping the Bivymok as of 8/3/2018. When funds clear with Indiegogo, it will be immediately shipped. 

*Do you ship outside the US?
Yes. Please go to https://gear.multimok.com for your order. The additional shipping charges will be a calculated there.

*Can I use my Bivymok tent in the air without the suspension platform?
No! The tent by itself is not designed to hold any weight and should not be suspended by itself.

*Will my underside get cold?
No, not by design if you use the right sleeping gear for the right temps. Unlike a common hammock there is little or no compression on your underside. Your bag does not fully compress underneath you. The natural loft of the bag pushes through the grid of the suspension platform providing the warmth you would expect from the bag you are in.

*Can I use a sleeping pad? Will it slip?
Yes! Sleeping pads are great whenever you can use them. By design, the grid will keep your pad in place if you slip the pad between the suspension platform and the tent. Always put your pad right on the skeleton for best results.

*Where can I find more setup information?
Look at our YouTube channel "multimok videos" for more setup information and HOWTOs.

*Can I use my Bivymok like an original Multimok?
Yes! If you want to use it just the same, just exclude the pole in the set up and sleep right on top of the rainfly. Ahhh!

*Does my Bivymok require four (4) support trees/poles/posts?
While the Bivymok shines on four trees it can just as easily be used on 3 trees. With mods it can be used on two trees. We have even seen people use it with one tree!

*Will the tent/fly fit on my previously purchased Multimok?
Yes! Our system is designed to be completely modular and interchangeable. All the dimensions of the skeleton have stayed the same.

*Is there a stand for those of us who tend to camp in deserts where there aren’t any trees for support?
We've designed the Bivymok to easily go to the ground where there are no trees! A stand is on our upcoming development board!

*I’m a bigger person.  How much weight can it hold?
1000 pounds (or a piano or a small horse)

*Really?
Yep!

*I’m still a bigger person. Will I fit?
No one likes feeling squished. The Multimok is over 8 feet long and more than 4 feet wide. Even Sasquatch can enjoy some hang time in the woods.

*Do you have underquilts?
You don’t need one if you have an appropriate sleeping bag. The grid system of the skeleton allows loft to get below you. If needed, you can place any insulating barrier between the skeleton and the Bivymok as an additional layer.

*Do you guys have any sweet, sweet SWAG?
Yes! Checkout https://gear.multimok.com/

*Is this really a two-person tent/hammock?
Yes, really! It’s the only true two person hammock where each person can have their own sleeping section. Sleep next to each other without smothering each other.

*I’m a side sleeper, will it work?
Yep! Sleep on your side, or stomach, or back or whatever.

*What kind of crazy math angles do I need to learn to hang this up?
None. It’s designed to be simple. Pulling it level and taut between trees/posts at waist height is all there is to know for basic set up.

*I was told that I need to sleep at a diagonal.
The Bivymok and Multimok are designed to function like a bed. If you can get into a bed, you can sleep just fine.

*How high do I have to hang this up? I’ve seen pictures of people hanging it at least 6 feet off the ground.
Have fun with it, if you want. Really, the ideal height is waist height. You should be able to get into it like you’re getting into a bathtub and still be elevated off the ground.  Some people just want to see how high they can go.

*Can I use it on the side of a cliff like a port-o-ledge?
Yes! Add a spreader bar for comfort.

*Do I have to have 4 trees?
If you want to hang the Multimok flat, four trees are ideal, especially for the Bivymok.  However, you can use your Multimok in any number of configurations.

*Do the trees have to be perfectly aligned?
Not at all.  We were able to hang the Multimok using a tree that was 60 feet away by using three 20 foot ratchet straps.  In nature, trees are rarely perfectly planted.

*What if there are three of us and only three trees?
Hang your Multimok hammocks in a pod configuration where the head of each Multimok connects to another Multimok.  The feet of each hammock connects to a tree.

*Do you need carabiners?
No, they are a convenience. They just make the world an easier place to hang. Multimok carabiners are rated at 24kn. If you are using your own, please make sure they are climbing carabiners rated at least 12kn.

Partner Donations

Packages that include partner donations are special! For each package purchased we will provide a $10 gear donation to our Partner. Through this three-way partnership we will provide up to $4000 in gear donations.

More About Our Partners

Gear Forward
Gear Forward is the only non-profit that is focused on collecting un-used and gently used outdoor gear from the outdoor community-at-large for donation to youth in need who are participating an outdoor themed non-profit program in the United States. Help us outfit the next generation of adventurers by donating you unused outdoor gear to Gear Forward. 

 

Hassle-Free Guarantee

We stand by our product. Our decisions focus around two main ideas great customer service and exceptional product quality. If our product does not stand up to normal everyday use it is covered for full replacement under our lifetime guarantee.

Technical Specifications

Please note the specs below of each component.

Exploded Detail

A complete Bivymok has three main parts that nest one on another. The first is what we call the skeleton, or the suspension platform. It holds all the weight when you set up off the ground. The second is the tent. It attaches to the skeleton with straps. It is lifted by a single aluminum pole and provided a bug-free zone in the sky. (It can also be used on the ground without the skeleton.) The third part is the rainfly. It attaches quickly over the top of the tent using straps to anchor it to the perimeter of the skeleton. It keeps you out of the rain and the grey panel provides a little extra shade.

While nesting in this way, it is worth noting that any combination or single use of each component is part of the design. For example, the skeleton can be used on its own, or the rainfly and skeleton can be used without the tent, etc. All combinations are possible!

Risks and Challenges

The risks for this project are 99% behind us. The product will be ready to ship during the first week of this campaign. Prototyping is complete. Production is over. Freight of the product has all but come to an end. It's time to Bivymok, not time to wait!

Package Comparison

It has a wide zippered entry at the front. The main attraction of this tent is its ability to submerge its occupants completely in nature by providing an unobstructed view of everything around you while keeping the bugs out. And if it looks like rain, the waterproofed rain fly can be easily added to maintain a dry hideaway.Hammock in the BackThe tent is designed to attach to our suspension platform to give you the best of both worlds, all the shelter you need with all the advantages of sleeping in comfort, midair. Our hammock platform can easily hold 1000 lbs, which really means, it's not delicate. There is no need to fear getting in or out. Our unique design also does away with falling through, falling off or being tossed out! AdvantagesIt's easy to see how a suspended tent is the next evolution in sleeping outdoors, from those that are looking to add more terrain opportunities to their campsite to those that are just starting out. Our looped ends in our suspension platform are where the versatility starts to show. With the many loops you have the flexibility to add what you want to your sleep fortress. story:
Short Summary

Grab Your Balls for Charity (GYBC) is an unincorporated non-profit organization that collects and distributes new and used soccer balls to children living in impoverished areas of the world.

GYBC would not be able to operate without the help of generous individuals, sports associations, and valuable friends/consultants. However, at the head of this organization there are only two people, Natalia Elmajian and Steven Slade (us). In the midst of work, school, coaching, and other projects, we have committed all of our spare time to GYBC and fueled it with our own funds. Now, for the first time, we are asking for your help.

 

What We Need

GYBC has managed to send over 300 balls to Ghana, Haiti, Nicaragua, Panama, and Guatamala, but we still have over 250 soccer balls in our inventory that need to be cleared out by the end of the summer. Our goal is to send 3-5 large shipments to impoverished communities internationally who share a great love for soccer. 

We want to include at least 50 soccer balls per shipment, along with shirts, jerseys, cleats and any other equipment we can fit into each package. This summer we want to go all out. One community at a time, we will provide everything they need to pursue their dreams. This innitiative will impact thousands of eager children who right now have little to no means to work towards a goal and pursue what they love.

Help us spread the beautiful game of soccer to everyone who deserves to play.

The Impact

GYBC has been in full swing for nearly 8 months and the reward could not have been greater. After sending over 300 balls to 6 developing countries, we have seen the amazing, positive change one ball can make. Perhaps the most dramatic and rewarding project GYBC embarked on that exemplifies this was our project to Port-au-Prince, Haiti.

Port-au-Prince fell victim to the disasterous earthquake in 2010, leaving many children orphaned, homeless, and feeling hopeless. Now 3 years later, the area and surrounding communities have slowly started to rebuild. When we  made a connection with 2 Haitian brothers (one living in Canada, the other in Haiti) we jumped on the opportunity to help this community.

We sent 32 soccer balls and 13 jerseys to our contact in Haiti for him to distribute to the community. The impact was both heartening and sobering. When the word got out that a package of soccer balls was to be distributed throughout the community, children came from far and wide to hopefully receive one. 

Sadly, many children left with nothing. Although balls were given to large groups of children to share, there was not enough for every group, and many left to trek back to their distant community empty handed.

This photo shows the crowd that gathered outside his door:

These are the local teams that gathered at their soccer pitch to receive a ball (1 ball per team):

This is where we began to feel disheartened. Our contact wrote "This boy came from a very far area but he’s not accompanied by his team. He didn't receive a ball and he is crying. But, he finally left very happy because he received a jersey."

We understand that there are children globally that do not get the support they deserve, but this particular child was so close to getting support from GYBC. For us, he gives a face to the millions of children worldwide that we are striving to help. The funds we raise this summer will first and foremost be used to give back to this community in Haiti. The high demand in this community, combined with their overwhelming love of soccer, makes it the perfect distribution location. Moreover, a second shipment exemplifies our efforts to beat the odds and help everyone we possibly can, including all the children that narrowly missed out on a ball from our past project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute a dollar amount to our campaign then help us by spreading the word. Check out www.gybc.ca to see pictures from past projects and keep up-to-date by liking us on facebook: www.facebook.com/gybc.ca

story:
We will be supporting local schools, assisting in medical clinics, building water filtration systems and facilitating a vacation bible school for children in Managua. Nicaragua. The money I raise will sponsor me to help cover costs of airfare, lodging at the mission house, bus transportation meals and project supplies. Thank you for considering sponsoring me!

Maddie

story:
Joe was like, "Hey, I'm coming home". We were like "Amazing". Then Joe was all like "Actually, I can't afford it." And we were all like "But what about our hearts and love and friendship and think of the children!". Then Dave was like, "I'll give $50 to see Joe"...

and so we thought...who else will give money to make the dream of Joe come true.

All of the proceeds will go to flying Joe home so we can hug him and kiss him and send him away again emboldened and fortified by the power of friendship.

story: Our family is missing a piece! My daughter lives with her dad far far away and we want her home for the Summer, to complete our puzzle. I'm stay at home Mom to my 2 year old son and he misses his sister! Let's get some plane tickets, so she can be here with us!
