story:
12,000+ Miles, 12 Months, 1 Dude and Endless adventure.

Take one part idealism and one part creative passion and turn it into one photographic adventure. As a sports and lifestyle photographer my passion is documenting people and places the way I see them. The Wayfarer Project was born from a place of loss and while I saw my life go into a tail spin very abruptly, I found what my true passion was from this period. Since that moment I've started the process of abandoning everything in search of lasting images and life changing experiences. Traveling for this visual project for 6-12 months will only be possible with your support!

What is “The Wayfarer Project” really?

 

Taking a 1980 VW Westfalia and turning it into a road ready home which will allow me to reach remote areas of the USA and document the most amazing landscapes and inspiring people I can find helping protect and play in our amazing lands. As simple and yet grand as it sounds it takes a lot of work. From gutting the van to make way for a new sustainable and lightweight interior or rebuilding the engine to take the abuse in its near future, it’s a process.

The addition of solar panels and batteries will allow me to charge my equipment and keep a small fridge powered for 2 days even without any sun. This allows me to be self-contained and free with my travels one day in Yosemite and maybe the next in Memphis (ok maybe next week, not day).

I will travel south in March on my way out to the west. After a few weeks I will head north into Canada and then back down until I reach Colorado and the Rockies. A few highlights:

· Yosemite

· Yellowstone

· Grand Tetons

· Oregon Coast

· Southern California

· Colorado

· Crater Lake

· Mt. Rainer

· Portland

· Mt. Shasta

· AND ON AND ON AND ON….

All of these places will be photographed and built into a series of works from each location. These photos will be available for purchase as prints or as downloads. And a LARGE portion of the proceeds will go to various charities to help sustain our amazing landscapes. By volunteering for and documenting the work of these groups I hope to draw more attention to their various causes. Your donations will allow me to travel and work on these projects. And the work I create will help these charities by raising awareness and providing funds from the sale of these works. 

 
  • American Trails 
  • American Rivers 
  • American Forests 
  • Big City Mountaineers 
  • Just to name a few!
 
A book will also be created with some photos exclusive to it along with writings and notes from the road. Kind of the most epic of all road trip books, EVER!And we hope this trip helps draw attention to our most precious resource, our land.

Along the way, a series of short films and documentaries will be created and shared as the trip progresses to help draw attention to the beauty outside.

The support I receive from this community will be the key to The Wayfarer Project being a success.

 

My goal of $8,000.00 will go towards:

  • Fuel, Permits and passes. AKA getting to the adventure.
  • Retrofitting the 1980 VW Westy with:
    • A sustainable interior made of lightweight wood.
    • A small fridge, propane stove and blinds!
    • And MUCH more!
  • A 145 Watt Solar Panel! Power up small fridge. Charge camera gear!
  • Help print, press, and design/distribute the book.
  • Help edit, film and legal junk for the short documentaries. 
  • Printing Shirts, Stickers and badges.

Most people, including myself, fear the unknown and the road is one of the biggest unknowns. But my fear has given way to wanderlust. While we all can't sell off our lives and jump into a van, we can all share in the ride. And that is the heart of this project. Discovery. I hope you support the journey and in turn you’ll enjoy your Prints or Book that much more!

If you can't help financially that is cool! Just follow The Wayfarer Project as I cruise around the country. Share your road stories and best hikes or hidden gems. And most importantly let people know what we are doing!

Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Tumblr!
story_txt:
12,000+ Miles, 12 Months, 1 Dude and Endless adventure.
Take one part idealism and one part creative passion and turn it into one photographic adventure. As a sports and lifestyle photographer my passion is documenting people and places the way I see them. The Wayfarer Project was born from a place of loss and while I saw my life go into a tail spin very abruptly, I found what my true passion was from this period. Since that moment I've started the process of abandoning everything in search of lasting images and life changing experiences. Traveling for this visual project for 6-12 months will only be possible with your support!
What is “The Wayfarer Project” really?
 

Taking a 1980 VW Westfalia and turning it into a road ready home which will allow me to reach remote areas of the USA and document the most amazing landscapes and inspiring people I can find helping protect and play in our amazing lands. As simple and yet grand as it sounds it takes a lot of work. From gutting the van to make way for a new sustainable and lightweight interior or rebuilding the engine to take the abuse in its near future, it’s a process.
The addition of solar panels and batteries will allow me to charge my equipment and keep a small fridge powered for 2 days even without any sun. This allows me to be self-contained and free with my travels one day in Yosemite and maybe the next in Memphis (ok maybe next week, not day).
I will travel south in March on my way out to the west. After a few weeks I will head north into Canada and then back down until I reach Colorado and the Rockies. A few highlights:
· Yosemite
· Yellowstone
· Grand Tetons
· Oregon Coast
· Southern California
· Colorado
· Crater Lake
· Mt. Rainer
· Portland
· Mt. Shasta
· AND ON AND ON AND ON….
All of these places will be photographed and built into a series of works from each location. These photos will be available for purchase as prints or as downloads. And a LARGE portion of the proceeds will go to various charities to help sustain our amazing landscapes. By volunteering for and documenting the work of these groups I hope to draw more attention to their various causes. Your donations will allow me to travel and work on these projects. And the work I create will help these charities by raising awareness and providing funds from the sale of these works. 
 


American Trails 
American Rivers 
American Forests 
Big City Mountaineers 
Just to name a few!


 
A book will also be created with some photos exclusive to it along with writings and notes from the road. Kind of the most epic of all road trip books, EVER!And we hope this trip helps draw attention to our most precious resource, our land.
Along the way, a series of short films and documentaries will be created and shared as the trip progresses to help draw attention to the beauty outside.
The support I receive from this community will be the key to The Wayfarer Project being a success.
 
My goal of $8,000.00 will go towards:

Fuel, Permits and passes. AKA getting to the adventure.
Retrofitting the 1980 VW Westy with:

A sustainable interior made of lightweight wood.
A small fridge, propane stove and blinds!
And MUCH more!

A 145 Watt Solar Panel! Power up small fridge. Charge camera gear!
Help print, press, and design/distribute the book.
Help edit, film and legal junk for the short documentaries. 
Printing Shirts, Stickers and badges.
Most people, including myself, fear the unknown and the road is one of the biggest unknowns. But my fear has given way to wanderlust. While we all can't sell off our lives and jump into a van, we can all share in the ride. And that is the heart of this project. Discovery. I hope you support the journey and in turn you’ll enjoy your Prints or Book that much more!
If you can't help financially that is cool! Just follow The Wayfarer Project as I cruise around the country. Share your road stories and best hikes or hidden gems. And most importantly let people know what we are doing!
Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Tumblr!

story:
Webley Dudd's Vision

The story of Lake CentrePointe begins with renowned conceptual artist Webley Dudd. His bold vision and determination, going all the way back to 2008, have placed Lake CentrePointe firmly in the realm of the possible. 

A pioneering "urban landscape sculptor," Dudd specializes in large, permanent installations that challenge our assumptions about land use, public space, and urban development. After completing a series of retail galleries exploring the concept of "vacancy," Dudd embarked on what he intended as his greatest masterpiece: CentrePointe, which was to be the largest, most expensive hotel Lexington had ever seen. 

The doubters had their questions: Why? How? Why? Critics lambasted the hotel's proposed "giant cock-and-balls" design —actually a cleverly disguised "single finger salute," a tribute to the people of Lexington — which they described variously as "ugly" and "monstrous" and "ugly."


Always eager to court controversy, Dudd used notoriety for the project as fuel for its engine, driving forward ever harder, unflinching in the face of mounting criticism, making his vision appear inevitable and unstoppable. And so it was. The CentrePointe behemoth buffaloed its way to zoning approval and generous public support in the form of tax increment financing.  

Phase 1, "The Big Bang," took place in 2008, with the demolition of a historic downtown block. The demolition eliminated or displaced several well-supported local businesses, including a popular music venue, a restaurant and bar, a "billiards and beer" joint, and a hat shop once owned by notorious independent filmmaker Terry Alan Grossman.

Unfortunately, several obstacles got in the way of Dudd's vision becoming a reality. First, an anonymous "international backer" — who totally existed in real life as an actual person — died, leaving the project short of funds needed to complete the hotel in time for the 2010 World Sexquestrian Games. But Dudd did not give up hope, even though it was apparent that nobody wanted the hotel, and that nobody could afford it. 

Community members attempted to re-purpose the vacant lot as an outdoor recreation facility. Dudd resisted these efforts and stayed true to his original vision, burning through six different designs and a succession of architects in the process. 

Phase 2, "CentreLawne," commenced in 2010, saw the demolition site leveled, filled with dirt, covered with grass, and surrounded by fencing. The lawn remained a popular downtown attraction for four years, but ultimately, Dudd decided he could no longer afford the time or the expense of "keeping those damn kids off of my lawn." It was time to move forward. 

Phase 3, "CentrePitte," undertaken in the spring of 2014, employed tons of explosives to blast a three-story-deep crater into the ground, earning CentrePitte a bit of positive press as "The Biggest Hole in Kentucky." While the pyrotechnics were impressive, they failed to persuade Kentucky lawmakers to hand over $30 million to finish the job.  

Phase 4, Lake CentrePointe, will be a radical re-envisioning of Webley Dudd's dream. Instead of a towering monolith, we propose a people-made oasis of calm in the middle of the city. Lake CentrePointe will provide opportunities for sailing, swimming, fishing — or doing nothing at all. 

What We Need & What You Get

We owe much to Dudd and his original vision. Ten years ago, a lake in the middle of downtown Lexington would have seemed ridiculous, even absurd, a sort of bad joke. Today, it seems like an attractive alternative.  

The good news is that the excavation has been completed, and the hole has already begun to fill with water. This puts us way ahead, relatively speaking, especially if you don't count the past six years, and we don't. But we still have a long way to go. 
  • We need $30 million to finish this project. That's how much Webley Dudd asked the state for, and, frankly, we think our plan is more realistic than his ever was. 
  • Funds will go toward acquiring the property, paying for a site survey and preliminary elevation plan drawings, obtaining zoning approval, hiring an architect to oversee execution of the final design, work crews, insurance, landscaping, tree-planting, construction of a marina with boat slips and fishing piers, stocking the lake with various species of fish, and purchasing a sailboat. 
  • Backers will get valuable rewards in the form of free boat rentals, family swimming passes, honorary naming rights, and lots of other stuff.  
  • If we do not reach our funding goal, any money collected will go toward paying off my student loan debt and buying a new laptop computer. (Note: A total of $42 was raised during this campaign from three contributors. Each of those contributions was refunded in April 2015.) 

The Impact

  • Lake CentrePointe will take an empty, unused city block and turn it into a gorgeous, thriving, outdoor recreation facility that is family-oriented and open to the public. 
  • Rather than a blight on our downtown landscape and an embarrassment to Lexington (why give Louisville any more ammunition?!), Lake CentrePointe will be an attraction that will bring people to Lexington from all over, to marvel at its beauty.
  • It's good for the economy! [This point needs development/support. –Ed.]

Risks & Challenges

Obviously, any venture of this magnitude — especially one in such a conspicuous location, where public and private interests become enmeshed and entangled — carries with it certain risks and challenges. After performing due diligence involving a rigorous economic analysis, multiple scenario studies, public opinion polling, multidimensional mathematical modeling, and other impressive-sounding stuff, we have arrived at the following conclusions: 
  • There is absolutely nothing that can possibly go wrong with this project.
  • If anything does go wrong, we are 100 percent certain that it was not our fault.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about our project and urge them to contribute!
  • Post a link on Facebook, or Tweet about us using Indiegogo share tools!
  • Don't forget your exclamation points!

story:
ENGLISH TEXT BELOW - TEXTO EN ESPAÑOL ABAJO

 

  • The perks are not representative of the price of future stays at Sierra Alta Lodge. They represents a promotion and a "thank you" for supporting the project with a donation.

 

  • Los regalos no representan los precios futuros en Sierra Alta Lodge. Éstos representan una promoción y una forma de agradecimiento por apoyar nuestro proyecto.

 

Sierra Alta Lodge:

 

 

Hi, we are Carlos, Elieth and Fadrique, we have a small tour agency, that we have built over the years, offering personalized treatment to our clients, but now the big hotel chains and tour agencies hog all the clients making it difficult to survive as a business. The desire to keep going is always there, with great effort we planned to diversify  our business model into making lodgings, where with can put our tourism expertise into action.

Your support in this project is decisive! Rest assured that your helping hand will be rewarded.

Project:

The construction project for Sierra Alta Lodge began in 2016 with great enthusiasm in expand our activities in the ecotourism area.

 

 

The construction location is excellent, is within walking distance of almost all the adventure parks in Monteverde, with good access to a gravel road, making it possible to visit all year round.

The construction process is halfway through the mark, having invested $12 000 of our own pocket. We still need a bit more to finish it and making the final touches, if we don't accomplish the $25 000 goal, it will slow us down but we will push forward to make it happen, we don't have any doubt about that.

Landscape & weather

Monteverde is one of the main Costa Rica's tourist destinations, a must in any tourist itinerary of anyone visiting Costa Rica.

It possesses a great biodiversity of flora and fauna. The weather is affected by the Caribbean wind, it tends to rain more heavily between September and October, and the dry season is between April and May.

 

The height and the rain make the cloud forest of Monteverde home to a variety of reptiles, insects, birds and mammals, of great attraction to all its visitors. 

The pure air y the vast vegetation make Monteverde a true jewel for naturalists and tourists of around the world.

Sierra Alta Lodge will let you enjoy of nearby, wonderful walks in hanging bridges, or following guided walks in trails into the woods, and of course, take the famous canopy tour, enjoying the action and the breathtaking view above the treeline.

 

Visiting the world famous Monteverde Cloud Forest Biological Reserve is a must, described by National Geographic as "the jewel in the crown of cloud forest reserves".

Others very famous reservations like Children's Eternal Rain Forest (the largest private reservation), Santa Elena Reserve.

 

Accommodation:

Sierra Alta Lodge will have, in its first phase, 4 private rooms. All rooms will have a beautiful view, at the front you will be able to see people taking the canopy tour, at the back you will have a panoramic view of the Nicoya Golf in the Pacific Ocean of Costa Rica.

Each room will have a private bathroom with hot water. In the phase 2 of the project, we are looking at using solar hot water heaters, to be more eco-friendly.

We are 100% committed to the development of the community, we don't believe in making ourselves rich but to be able to have a good life and help others have a good life too. This new project is no different, we will create jobs for people of the area, to make a good partnership, and help each other out.

 

Environmental Commitment:

The environmental activities we arrange every year for the last 20 years among them, the tree planting in areas like watersheds, with the help of a student program we have with Muhlenberg College. So far, in this program alone, we have been able to plant more than two thousands native trees with more forest canopy and fruits to serve as food to birds and monkeys of the area.

If you help us with the "tree" perk, we will plant a tree for you, it will have a little identifier  and we will upload the pictures to our Facebook page. We usually plant endangered tree species, so you will helping us AND the mother nature.

 

You can make the difference in helping our project come true!

...............................................................................................................................................

 

Español

 

Sierra Alta Lodge:

 

 

Hola, somos Carlos, Elieth y Fadrique, tenemos conformada una pequeña empresa familiar dedicada  al turismo educativo y ambiental. El deseo de ampliar nuestro campo de acción, pero siempre en el área del turismo, nos impulsó a construir un módulo de cabinas en Monteverde en 2016.

 

 

 

Proyecto:

 

La ubicación del terreno en construcción es excelente, en un sector de Monteverde donde se desarrollan los parques temáticos del Bosque Nuboso con todas sus atracciones para los turistas. El acceso es por una calle de lastre en buen estado, lo cual hace posible la visitación durante todo el año. La construccion lleva un 50% de adelanto con inversión de aproximadamente doce mil dólares, de nuestros propios recursos.

 

Paisaje y clima:

 

Monteverde es un destino turístico infaltable en el itinerario de la mayoría de los turistas que visitan Costa Rica.

La biodiversidad de flora y fauna, característica de la zona, atrae a los visitantes. El clima que recibe influencia de los vientos alisios que soplan del Mar Caribe, propician que llueva en abundancia, especialmente en los meses de setiembre y octubre con hasta 2500 mm. y los meses más secos son abril y mayo.

La altura hace que predominen las temperaturas más frescas durante todo el año, así como favorece la presencia del bosque nuboso, hábitat de especies muy diversas, siendo uno de los principales atractivos la majestuosa belleza del quetzal, que es posible admirar entre febrero y julio.

La abundancia de reptiles, aves, insectos y mamíferos, propios del ecosistema, son un regalo para las personas que visitan sus áreas de protección, unido al aire puro que es una riqueza incalculable para la humanidad.

El proyecto de Sierra Alta, permite disfrutar de caminatas en los puentes colgantes, senderos del bosque y los canopy para conocer el bosque desde las copas de los árboles.

Permite además, por su cercanía, visitar zonas protegidas como El bosque Eterno de los Niños, Reserva de Monteverde y Reserva de Monteverde, así como la Finca Ecológica.

 

Alojamiento:

 

El proyecto constará en su primera etapa con un módulo de cuatro habitaciones triples, con una cama individual y una cama doble, dos en la planta baja y dos en la planta alta. Cada una contará con baño privado con agua caliente. El disfrute del paisaje se facilita con una terraza en el segundo piso, para observar el canopy que se  ve al frente de la edificación de Sierra Alta. En la parte posterio se puede observar el Golfo de Nicoya, en el Pacífico de Costa Rica.

En una próxima etapa esperamos poder instalar un calentador solar, para tener agua caliente en los baños con un sistema ecoamigable.

Nuestro interés es favorecer las prácticas ambientales y propiciar la creación de empleos con personas de la zona, lo cual les permitirá elevar su nivel de vida, y nuestro deseo en ampliar los servicios a los visitantes, pero de la mano con nuevos proyectos ambientales. No nos anima la ambición de tener mucho dinero, pero sí ampliar los proyectos y permitir que se fortalezca el trabajo comunitario y en favor del medio ambiente, que nos caracteriza.

 

 

Compromiso con el ambiente:

 

Las actividades ambientales que realizamos desde hace veinte años, se identifican con la siembra de árboles en áreas cercanas a las cuencas de los ríos, con la colaboración de los estudiantes del Muhenberg College de Pensilvania y su mentor el Dr. Richard Niesenbaum, habiendo ya plantado más de dos mil árboles de especies nativas para proporcionar oxígeno al Planeta, así como frutos para las aves y los monos, aparte de fortalecer el recurso agua que es vital para nuestras comunidades.

Si usted adquiere la donación de un árbol, pndremos su nombre a la planta sembrada y a la vez será publicado en nuestra página de facebook, como contribuyente con el bienestar del Planeta. Generalmente plantamos especies en peligro de extinción en fincas de los alrededores de la cuenca del río Abangares y áreas cercanas que forman parte de un corredor biológico hacia Monteverde. 

Usted puede hacer la diferencia al apoyar un proyecto que aumentará los beneficios ambientales y laborales con nuestra iniciativa de expansión.

La biodiversidad de flora y fauna, característica de la zona, atrae a los visitantes. El clima que recibe influencia de los vientos alisios que soplan del Mar Caribe, propician que llueva en abundancia, especialmente en los meses de setiembre y octubre con hasta 2500 mm. y los meses más secos son abril y mayo.

 

La altura hace que predominen las temperaturas más frescas durante todo el año, así como favorece la presencia del bosque nuboso, hábitat de especies muy diversas, siendo uno de los principales atractivos la majestuosa belleza del quetzal, que es posible admirar entre febrero y julio.
La abundancia de reptiles, aves, insectos y mamíferos, propios del ecosistema, son un regalo para las personas que visitan sus áreas de protección, unido al aire puro que es una riqueza incalculable para la humanidad.
El proyecto de Sierra Alta, permite disfrutar de caminatas en los puentes colgantes, senderos del bosque y los canopy para conocer el bosque desde las copas de los árboles.


Permite además, por su cercanía, visitar zonas protegidas como El bosque Eterno de los Niños, Reserva de Monteverde y Reserva de Monteverde, así como la Finca Ecológica.

 
Alojamiento:
 
El proyecto constará en su primera etapa con un módulo de cuatro habitaciones triples, con una cama individual y una cama doble, dos en la planta baja y dos en la planta alta. Cada una contará con baño privado con agua caliente. El disfrute del paisaje se facilita con una terraza en el segundo piso, para observar el canopy que se  ve al frente de la edificación de Sierra Alta. En la parte posterio se puede observar el Golfo de Nicoya, en el Pacífico de Costa Rica.
En una próxima etapa esperamos poder instalar un calentador solar, para tener agua caliente en los baños con un sistema ecoamigable.
Nuestro interés es favorecer las prácticas ambientales y propiciar la creación de empleos con personas de la zona, lo cual les permitirá elevar su nivel de vida, y nuestro deseo en ampliar los servicios a los visitantes, pero de la mano con nuevos proyectos ambientales. No nos anima la ambición de tener mucho dinero, pero sí ampliar los proyectos y permitir que se fortalezca el trabajo comunitario y en favor del medio ambiente, que nos caracteriza.


 
 
Compromiso con el ambiente:
 
Las actividades ambientales que realizamos desde hace veinte años, se identifican con la siembra de árboles en áreas cercanas a las cuencas de los ríos, con la colaboración de los estudiantes del Muhenberg College de Pensilvania y su mentor el Dr. Richard Niesenbaum, habiendo ya plantado más de dos mil árboles de especies nativas para proporcionar oxígeno al Planeta, así como frutos para las aves y los monos, aparte de fortalecer el recurso agua que es vital para nuestras comunidades.
Si usted adquiere la donación de un árbol, pndremos su nombre a la planta sembrada y a la vez será publicado en nuestra página de facebook, como contribuyente con el bienestar del Planeta. Generalmente plantamos especies en peligro de extinción en fincas de los alrededores de la cuenca del río Abangares y áreas cercanas que forman parte de un corredor biológico hacia Monteverde. 

Usted puede hacer la diferencia al apoyar un proyecto que aumentará los beneficios ambientales y laborales con nuestra iniciativa de expansión.

story:
How many times have you arrived at a campground, trailhead or ski resort only to find yourself at the back of the car doing a balancing act on top of your shoes while you try to change into your gear without getting your feet dirty or wet? 

I designed the Adventure Mat as the ultimate solution to the changing hassle. It's the smart way to change outdoors – simple to use, always clean on top, and when you’re done, it can be folded up with just one hand and tucked away. No awkward balancing or mess. Plus, there are countless other uses for the Adventure Mat, from showering and laying out gear to preparing meals and playing games.

Enjoying the outdoors just got that much more enjoyable.

 

THE ADVENTURE MAT IS GREAT FOR: Camping • Hiking • Skiing • Snowboarding • Cycling • Mountain Biking • Trail Running • Triathlons • Rock Climbing • Surfing • Paddleboarding • Boating • Fishing • Hunting • Snowshoeing • Golf • Baseball • Soccer • Motorcycle Touring • Travel • Families • Dog-owners • Picnics • Concerts • Outdoor activities of all kinds!

 

Simple one-handed fold. The bottom side never touches the top.

 

When I set out to the design the Adventure Mat, I had three main goals in mind: Make it simple, compact, and clean. I wanted a mat that could be used on dirt, wet ground or snow and then be easily packed away, ready for another use without having to clean it.

After working through many design iterations, I finally arrived at the patent pending ‘magical’ folding design to achieve the following:

  • Always Clean on Top: Dirty bottom side never touches the top.
  • Simple: Only one hand needed to fold and unfold.
  • Compact: Folds down to a 6.5” x 6.5” square.
  • Packable: Stores easily in  waterproof pouch.

 

Unfold and fold your Adventure Mat using just this hand-hold.

 

Quickly go from a 3 sq ft surface to a compact 6.5"x6.5" square.

 

Easy to fold up with just one hand.

 

The top side magically stays clean!

 

Use your Adventure Mat year-round for changing outdoors, a doormat for your tent, a place to organize gear and much more. It provides a clean, comfortable surface that grips well on dirt, mud, snow, public shower floors and pretty much anywhere else you can imagine taking it.

 

Use it again and again. Made from durable materials, easy-to-clean and quick-drying, the Adventure Mat is built to last!

 

Why the Extra Flap?

  • Keeps all sides of the mat clean when folded
  • Extra space for one foot
  • A place for your phone, keys, beverage, etc.

story:
The Deep End: Colombia

Once again, I will be tearing away from the familiar and immersing myself in a country and culture I know very little about, Colombia. The only plan is to enter the country and follow intuition for 6 weeks of exploration and adventure. A photobook and fine art prints will be produced during this trip, as well as "from the road" travel blogging.

We all allow ourselves to slowly become lulled into willing automatons to the point that we no longer notice the details of what's going on around us. I have discovered that while traveling, I'm paying much closer attention to all the little details you normally tend to filter out when at home in familiar surroundings. That heightened state of awareness tends to inspire new vision and tends fuel and facilitate intense creative thought. You can get to this state of mind anywhere, even at home, but while traveling the potential to see the world from a completely new perspective is much greater.

The first version of this project was called "Off The Deep End ~ A Visual Swan Dive into the Unknown" produced a Magcloud Photo Book and was travel blogged HERE 

The idea for this one is similar, only the majority of the content from the road will be available to backers only, no promotion for the project will take place from the road, and now the title is now simply "The Deep End: Colombia" 

This time it will be all about the shared experiences and images captured with updates for supporters and project exclusive ePublications. 

The public blog will go private when this campaign is completed May 12th. Supportors will be given login info by that date to access the content and participate as virtual stowaways for the adventure!

Join me on this journey and thank you very much for your support!

Please spread the word to anyone and everyone you think might dig my project by all the sharing tools like facebook like, tweet, Google+1, Pin, etc. to help me get the word out. Any help I can get sharing this will be paramount to the project's success and most appreciated!

story:
Introducing V-Blanket, the world’s first portable battery-powered heated blanket that can be transformed into a hooded cape to, let you stay warm while moving freely in any season. It features LED for reading, camping, cycling, etc. 

 

 

The heating material was weaved in with fibers using a revolutionary technology which makes it imperceptible. It warms your seconds and keeps you toasty for hours. The temperature of the evenly distributed heating zones can be adjusted on different levels for optimal comfort. The interior is made with premium cotton twill that maximumly traps the heat. The exterior is 100% waterproof. It is washer-safe and packs down into an accompanying sack for easy carrying. It has a built-in USB port to keep your devices charged while keeping you warm. 

 

 

 

V-Blanket provides warmth, fits snugly and offers excellent mobility in wide applications: camping, sporting events, everyday use, poor circulation, travel, emergencies, etc.    

 

 

 

V-Blanket has LED lights sewn on both the chest and the back of the cape. It illuminates constantly as a book light for reading indoors while keeping you warm, or intermittently as a flashlight to increase your visibility in the darkness for safety purposes while camping or cycling.

 

 

The LED light is ergonomically designed on the blanket with particular angle and size to cast soft, shadowless light without directly flashing into your eyes, yet suffices to see clearly while reading. 

 

 

 

Having clear advantages over traditional heated blankets that use built-in heating panels that are bulky, inflexible and uncomfortable to the feel, V-Blanket uses state-of-the-art carbon fiber weaved in with other fibers to create an ultra-fine and flexible texture, delivering the coziest and most comfortable warmth you can ever imagine.

 

 

 

 

The powerful V-Blanket heating system includes 5 inherent heating zones. Heat is instantly turned on via a press on the control button and evenly distributed leaving no areas that never heat up.

 

 

 The temperature of different heating zones is controlled by different buttons.

 

HOW TO USE:

Plug-In – Connect the power bank to the plug, which is installed in the pocket.
 

Turn On – Press and hold button control for 3 seconds and the button will flash red.
 

Temperature Adjustment– Press the button again to modify heating levels.

V-Blanket reaches 30°C (85°F) in just 30 seconds, providing instant warmth in any weather conditions. 

 

 

 

Control the temperature settings on V-Blanket with the touch of a button and choose from high, medium or low heat depending on how cold it is outside. The button changes in brightness to indicate the heating level after being pressed:

 

 

 

The interior of V-Blanket is made with a soft, thick, warm cotton twill that has great heat retention and provides excellent warmth and comfort. The exterior is made with 100% waterproof nylon that is aimed to give you extra protection from wind, water, and the elements.

 

 

 

 Unlike traditional heated blankets, which are notorious for bulky components and tangling cords, V-Blanket works at a non-hazardous 5V low voltage that it can be powered by any type of USB external battery pack. It also has a built-in female USB-A connector to charge your mobile device while keeping you warm and cozy. It is ideal for outdoor sporting events, untethered use on the couch, or chilly airplane cabins.

 

 

V-Blanket is incredibly lightweight and packable. It measures 54.5” x 38.5” when laid flat and weighs just 1.5 lbs. It compresses into a stuffed pack that measures 14.8” x 7.9”. With V-Blanket, you are always prepared for unexpected weather on vacations and holidays.

 

 

 

V-Blanket is both machines and hands washable, so you can just throw it in the washer with no worries. It can also be spin-dried at a low temperature.

 

 

 

V-Blanket does not sacrifice style for utility. In addition to its superior heat functionality, it comes in three different colors that are all very fashionable and stylish.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

V-Blanket full function test

How to set up V-Blanket

 

 

We are a professional heated apparel manufacturer and have over 15 years' experience with design and production on heated garments. V-Blanket was designed by our new team Heated Hub.

Our designer, Annie L.F. Wang, works in the ready-made garment industry for over 30 years and is very experienced in applying ergonomics to improve the garment’s comfortability and practicality.

During the winter, the weather changes fast and becomes cold. We know all the people need something can easy to take with them that's convenient to use. So, we came up with the idea of the heated throw and called V-Blanket. The products can keep up a human's body temperature but also generate heat to let people getting warm.

We know have a very good team on design and production, and we know our design and production ability will make this heated throw as a necessity and the perfect item for people to use.

story:
Hey Indiegogo!

We are IMPETRO Gear, a new outdoor gear company based in Salzburg, Austria.

We are mountain sports enthusiasts, who designed something completely new and we need your support to make it happen!

We are not bringing a backpack only, but a whole family! Our concept aims to avoid any compromises. 

 

 

We wanted the best backpack experience so we had to design sport-specific packs, hence a complete ecosystem for mountain sports. The main components of our modular system are the X-Harness BASE_Unit and the Zip-On Packs: the BIKE, SKI & MOUNTAIN packs.

 

The common component for all your tours. Equipped with all the features you need to perform, the BASE_Unit will support you in every mountain activity you undertake.

 

 

 Anywhere you go, any sport you do, either clipped to go fast or open to fully breathe, our BASE_Unit will increase your performance.

 

 

 

 

"We care about your safety too!"

Because we care about you, we believe in accident prevention and being ready for anything. So every BASE_UNIT integrates a really important safety feature:

 

 

The ultimate summer activity. What a nice feeling to hit the trails after a long work week. Single trails, short/long curves, jumps, dirt,... you name it!

 

 

 

Climb longer and better, but of course... bomb the downs harder, faster, stronger!

 

 

 

 

 

Whether you call it ski touring, freeriding, free touring, etc... we all have the same goal: Enjoying the freshest snow!

 

 

The tougher the climb up, the more fun the ride down. Whichever direction you are traveling, our SKI_Pack will make the adventure more enjoyable!  

 

 

 

 

 

 

Whether you are planning on going for a hike, crossing a glacier or climbing a 4000m high summit, this pack is made for it!

 

 

Whether it is dirt, rocks or ice our MOUNTAIN_Pack has your back!

 

 

 

 

 

Once you have selected your reward, you will be able to add one or both of those items:

 

  • Hydrapak Force 2L hydration reservoir for a special Indiegogo price of €30. This high-end reservoir is perfect to get your Impetro Gear setup to the next level.

 

 

 

  • SAS-TEC back protector Level 1 for a special Indiegogo price of €10. This viscoelastic shield will harden on impact to protect your body during your aggressive rides.

 

 

 

You will be able to choose the exact pack combo you want as soon as the campaign ends. No need to worry about that now! All details like shipping preferences, add-ons specifics, and the set combo will be collected via survey late November. More information in the FAQ.

 

 

 

 

 

 

This is the essence of our brand. We strive to develop the best product possible because we want those products, and also want you to enjoy them. 

 

 

We started the whole project back in February 2017 during a long car drive. We started talking about backpacks... and here we are 34 months later, launching our first Indiegogo In Demand. We went through hours upon hours of talking, trying, failing, but in the end, always with the same goal in mind; we made it all the way here. 

We really hope you enjoy what we managed to build so far, and that you will help us going further by backing this project.

Thank you for your interest, and stay outdoors!

They all believe in the product and already helped us to get this far..... We thank them for their support and their trust.

It is now your turn to show they were right all along, and back this project.

 

 

 

EN /   Keep in mind that we have already answered the most common questions in the FAQ, but we remain available to answer your questions in the comment section.

FR /   N'oubliez pas que nous avons déjà répondu aux questions les plus fréquentes dans la FAQ, mais que nous sommes également disponibles pour vous répondre dans les commentaires.

DE /   Beachten Sie, dass wir bereits die häufigste Frage in den FAQ beantwortet haben, aber wir stehen Ihnen im Kommentarbereich für Ihre Fragen zur Verfügung.

ES & IT /   We will try to do our best, but we might no be able to be as reactive as the other languages.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

IMPETRO Gear is a young company but we are confident that with your help, we will be able to live up to expectations for this product. 

Most of the challenges we faced were addressed during the product development phase. We put a lot of thought, time and money into our designs. Many prototypes and samples have been produced and tested for months. Several things have been improved step by step and we are proud to say: our design is now ready for production.

The search for factories, skilled staff, as well as the language barrier with our suppliers and the time zone difference did not make our life easy. We have been sourcing, developing fabrics and hardware together with our suppliers and manufacturing partners intensively during the last 2 years. We know our manufacturing partner, have visited them a couple of times and manufactured final samples with them already.

Given the high cost of materials, manufacturing and minimum order quantities from the factory, finding the funds for production is our biggest challenge.

But each challenge remains an opportunity for us to acquire new knowledge and allows us to improve each of the entrepreneurial skills that the creation and development of a company requires. We face it with enthusiasm and see these challenges as the steps to take our business to the next level.

We also want to inform you that customs and taxes are not included in the price. Depending on your home country you might have to fill out a customs declaration and pay customs fees and taxes before you get your reward. We can't cover any compensation claims that arise due to your personal effort while handling these issues. Thank you for your understanding.

We will do our best to support you in every matter though, please contact us for any queries.

Your IMPETRO Gear Team

We have been sourcing, developing fabrics and hardware together with our suppliers and manufacturing partners intensively during the last 2 years. We know our manufacturing partner, have visited them a couple of times and manufactured final samples with them already.Given the high cost of materials, manufacturing and minimum order quantities from the factory, finding the funds for production is our biggest challenge.But each challenge remains an opportunity for us to acquire new knowledge and allows us to improve each of the entrepreneurial skills that the creation and development of a company requires. We face it with enthusiasm and see these challenges as the steps to take our business to the next level.We also want to inform you that customs and taxes are not included in the price. Depending on your home country you might have to fill out a customs declaration and pay customs fees and taxes before you get your reward. We can't cover any compensation claims that arise due to your personal effort while handling these issues. Thank you for your understanding.We will do our best to support you in every matter though, please contact us for any queries.Your IMPETRO Gear Team

story:
Meet Infinite—the “Swiss Army Knife” of coolers

Other coolers are too bulky to haul around, don't retain ice very long or don't have room to store all your things.

Infinite re-defines the way you experience outdoor life.

With the 61 quart capacity and up to 12 days of ice retention, you can jam-pack all the fun you want for an extended trip.

The built-in 550W blender lets you whip up any drinks you want on your boat trip or tailgate.

Blast the integrated bluetooth speakers to get the party started and keep your electronics charged with the wireless phone charger and built-in USB ports. 

Whether you’re soaking up rays at the beach with friends or grubbing on some backyard BBQ with family, Infinite takes all the stress out of planning for an outdoor excursion.

 

As Featured In

 

 

Features To Take You Outdoors

 

7-12 Day Ice Retention

Need a better reason to extend your trips? Well here it is: Powder-insulated walls. This keeps ice frozen longer, up to 12 days, which is twice as long as traditional coolers. Shoutout to the newest innovation of nanotechnology that replaces electric power to keep the cooler insulated. We’ve developed a special nano-powder insulation material that not only works with current insulation materials on the market, but also reduces thermal conductivity down to only 20%. In addition, you can fill the Chill Divider with water and freeze it to preserve your ice even longer.

61 Quart Capacity

With all this room, you can fit a tiny penguin in here. But seriously, the large capacity interior lets you store more food and even more drinks—it can hold up to 55 water bottles! And since nobody wants a soggy sandwich, the removable Chill Divider helps separate your food, drinks and ice.

550 Watts Blender

BYOB (Be Your Own Bartender). Strawberry daiquiri, anyone? How about a margarita on the rocks? There’s nothing more relaxing than kicking back with a cocktail or smoothie on a hot day. With Infinite’s ice-crushing blender, you can create refreshing concoctions no matter where you are.

It takes 2 hours to fully charge the blender's battery. You can blend up to 100 drinks (500ml cup) in a single charge.

Hi-Fi Dual-Powerful Bluetooth Speakers

Let’s face it, the volume on your phone isn’t loud enough. And a party without music is, well, kinda sad. Thankfully, the Cooler Gods equipped Infinite with Hi-Fi dual-powerful speakers. You can be a DJ and play music on your Bluetooth-enabled device directly to your Infinite. All the more reason to create that perfect playlist for your next outdoor party.

Large Sturdy Wheels

Large wide wheels to conquer dirt, rocks, and grass. The wheels are made of ABS and rubber. The Infinite Cooler is made with a special hexagonal design and 2x larger diameter to make the cooler easy to drag. Infinite’s durable wheels are designed to hold up under a heavy load and make it easier to transport anywhere.

Wireless Charger and USB Ports

When you’re in the great outdoors, it’s important to stay powered up. Stay connected with Infinite’s dual USB ports and wireless charger. Even hardcore outdoor enthusiasts need their phones charged.

Infinite Cooler Battery

The Infinite cooler battery will last for 4-5 hours with all the features on. It takes 2 hours to fully charge the Infinite Cooler battery.

Multifunction Fork, Utensils, Cutting Board and Bottle Opener

Short on plates? Forget utensils? Don’t worry, Infinite brings the kitchen outdoors. Each cooler is organized with all the essential tools you need for a picnic or BBQ.  It makes prepping food and drinks faster and much easier.

Bungee Cord

Nobody wants to take multiple trips to the car. Eliminate the need for extra baggage with built-in bungee ropes. The tie-down bungee cord helps secure and transport everything easily in one trip.

LED Light

When the sun goes down, the party doesn’t stop. Light up your party with Infinite’s LED light.

Digital Screen + Easy-Touch Buttons

We’re digitalizing your outdoor experience. Infinite’s Digital Screen displays the inside temperature of the cooler.

Use the Easy-Touch Buttons to power the cooler on/off, and control the Bluetooth, LED lights and built-in camera.

Water Drain

You asked, we listened: every Infinite Cooler will now come with a water drain!

Thank you to everyone who asked about it. We love receiving all of your feedback, and we’re always open to suggestions to improving Infinite Cooler. Fortunately, since a water drain was already built into one of our preliminary models, we’ll be ramping that one up! Since this is the case, this water drain feature would not affect our production timeline which means WE’RE STILL ON TRACK FOR SHIPPING - huzzah!

 

Colors

Radiant Red: Just like the sun radiates down on a perfect summer day, this red was created to channel positive energies and unleash the fun on all your outdoor adventures.

Crater Lake Blue: Inspired by the blue waters of Oregon’s Crater Lake. This blue was carefully crafted as a reminder to never stop exploring, and to always let your adventurous spirit guide you.

The Cooler That's Infinitely Cooler 

 

Exterior of the Infinite Cooler

 

Interior of the Infinite Cooler

 

Blender and Speaker Demo

“Why Infinite Cooler?”

 

 

What's in the Box

 

 

Infinite App

 

 

Tech Specs

 

Perks

 

 

Stretch Goal

 

 

Behind the Scenes

 

Why do we need your support?

Crowdfunding on Indiegogo is a great way to introduce Infinite to the masses. We’re not just selling a cooler – we’re creating a new way for you to experience outdoor life and to have you participate in the product development journey, from vision to testing to launch. And this is just the beginning. We can’t wait for you to join us!

How did this idea come to fruition?

Infinite was created with the mission of making high-quality, easy-to-use, multi-function coolers for everyone. We believe big things always come in one package – that’s why we created an all-in-one party box to help you solve the problem of grabbing too much extra stuff for outdoor parties.

In creating the Infinite Coolers we focused on 3 things: quality, versatility and convenience. We wanted to learn from the mistakes of other brands, so we partnered with our user community to create a cooler that is useful, easy-to-use and affordable. It has the features users want, in an elegant, simple design.

Bringing the Infinite Cooler to life

Our prototype was finalized in 2017, and we spent over 9 months testing and improving it. The trial production will start just after the crowdfunding campaign. We always believe that the real value of something can be judged only from practical experience or results and not from theory. The earlier we make our production into a trial process, the faster we can send all the coolers to our backers.

 

 

Meet the Team

 

The Infinite Cooler team boasts decades of combined experience in engineering, manufacturing, supply chain management and user experience, guaranteed to have what it takes to deliver a phenomenal product to backers within a reasonable timeframe. Co-founder Todd E. Maddox has over 15 years working on all aspects of production and structural engineering projects for outdoor goods such as party tents and sun shades for major companies. Co-founder Leo Wang is an electronic engineering with over 7 years experience in circuit design, technical documentation, PCB design, and manufacturing support. Co-founder Alvin Gao is a distribution, marketing, and planning expert that is focused on delivering a delightful user experience for customers.

 

Timeline to Delivery

 

 

Shipping

 

Manufacturing capability

Infinite’s capabilities are constantly growing to meet the continuously changing demands of the outdoor marketplace. We offer a truly broad range of services from traditional cooler manufacture to the latest outdoor all-in-one box, from concept to completion, including design, manufacture, and supply.

At Infinite, we’ve invested heavily in manufacturing capability that will enable us to offer a comprehensive range. Rotational molding offers design advantages over other molding processes. With proper design, parts assembled from several pieces can be molded as one part, eliminating high fabrication costs.

Where are we now?

Currently, there are 20 rotational molding units and 8 large-scale machines, which provides a monthly production capacity of 5,000 coolers.

From incoming material inspection, procedure control, to finished product inspection, Infinite has a well established, high-efficient production process and stringent quality control system to ensure high-quality productions and timely delivery.

 

 

FAQ

 

PRODUCT

How can I get an Infinite Cooler?

The only way to get one is through our Indiegogo page here! Earliest backers get 60% off from the future retail price $599.

What’s the size is this cooler？

This is a 61 quart cooler. This means you can put a whopping fifty five (55) 18.5oz/550ml bottles into it.

How much does the cooler weigh when it's empty？

The Infinite Cooler weighs 10.5kg/23lbs when empty.

What are the speaker specifications?

The Infinite Cooler has built-in Hi-Fi dual-powerful Bluetooth speakers:

Bluetooth: 4.0

Power: 20w

Duration: 12 Hours

Frequency Response: 90Hz-20KHz

Signal to noise ratio (SNR): ≥60dB

How long does the cooler battery last?

With all the functions running simultaneously, the battery may last for up to 4 hours.

How can I charge this cooler？

Infinite Cooler comes with a removable battery. Just remove the battery and place it in the included charger to juice up. 

Does this have a built in battery to use the blender?

Yes. There is an independent 550w battery for the blender. This is a separate battery from the cooler so that you can power your outdoor life for days.

Can I use this cooler in the places other than America?

Yes, the removable the battery for Infinite Cooler can be re-charged from a 110v or 220v outlet. Since we are using USB-B ports to charge, it is possible for customers all around the world to use it.

Does the Infinite Cooler come in multiple colors?

Yes! As of now, we have Red and Blue. We will introduce new colors as we hit our stretch goals.

Where would this ship from?

Infinite has already got our logistics partners, and all the coolers would be shipped from local areas

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges and unforeseen obstacles that arise when trying to bring a product to life, especially when it comes to a cooler with so many innovative features.

We’ve actually completed all pre-manufacturing steps before starting this project, but still there are some risks that you might want to know:

1) Supply chain：A hazard for any company is that the supply of certain components or materials dries up. To mitigate this we manufacture in Shenzhen, the world’s hub for the electronics manufacturer, and we have backups lined up so that we aren’t reliant on any single component supplier.

2) Certification: The Hi-Fi dual Bluetooth speakers in the cooler must be certified before they can be mass manufactured which can take time. The risk of delays here is minimal as we already got several options that could solve this problem in no time.

3）Shipping：Global shipping and warehousing logistics are mind-boggling. Hence, we have a partner with over 10 years of warehouse management experience. We understand that weather, port congestion, and other uncontrollable factors are also on the table.

Is there a warranty?

Definitely! All Infinite Coolers come with a 1 year warranty against defects.

story:
Press & editorial inquiries, click here for more information

or contact us pr@smrtgadget.com

Stretch Goal #2 Titanium Gray - Back us NOW to receive yours in this exclusive color

 

 

For those who have questions about Perks and How To Use Indiegogo, CLICK HERE. 

 

Nico Nikolic, with an addiction for beautiful sharp objects from a young age, is a professional photographer turned designer. By combining his experience from the French military and his passion for the outdoors, Nico has created the best value micro blade that EDC fans can dream of.

As a longtime enthusiast in the pocket knife community, Nico spent a lot of time understanding what makes a design functional and timeless.

Black Panther is designed with functionality in mind, making light work of the toughest tasks. From starting fires, cutting boxes and cords, to escaping from windows in an emergency, we’ve engineered every part of this micro blade to be versatile in all situations.

Press & editorial inquiries, click here for more information

or contact us pr@smrtgadget.com

What can this small knife be used for? We thought you'd never ask. Integrating Black Panther's built-in features with accessory options, the possibilities are endless. Here are just a few examples, and the list just goes on...

 

  • Fire Starter 

A common misconception is striking a firesteel rod with the cutting side of the blade. Doing so damages your blade, and it's not necessary when we know you put in time and effort for blade maintenance. We've designed a notch on the back of the blade, specifically for striking firesteel rods. The notch fits most rods, and it allows you to start fires easily, without damaging the blade. 

 

 

  • Bottle Opener 

Who doesn't like opening a bottle like a badass?

 

 

  • Cutting & Carving 

The hawkbill blade design "grabs" onto whatever it's cutting. The result? You don't have to apply too much force, a little force goes a long way, and cuts smooth like a hot knife through butter.   

 

 

 

 

  • Emergency Escape (with Glass Breaker)

"The best camera is the one you have with you."

We hope you never have to be in an emergency situation like this, but it's important to have the necessary tool when things happen. 

  

 

  • Stealth Carry (with Pocket Clip)

Whether you're in the midst of urban jungle or out in the wild, Black Panther has you covered. You can use it to process wood, start a fire, break out of an emergency situation, open a beer bottle, or cut just about anything for daily tasks.

We like things that are practical, and when they come in style? Even better.

​​

 

 

 

 

 

 

Compact design for convenience

 Speaking of style, here's more -

Stretch Goal #2 - Titanium Gray

Stretch Goal #2 - Titanium Gray

Stretch Goal #2 - Titanium Gray

 

Press & editorial inquiries, click here for more information

or contact us pr@smrtgadget.com

We've engineered Black Panther with useful features and durability, every part of the blade was designed with functionality in mind. 

  • Blade Length: 4 cm (1.6 inches)   
  • Closed Length: 6.6 cm (2.6 inches) 
  • Open Length: 10.6 cm (4.2 inches) 
  • Blade Thickness: 2.8 mm (0.11 inches)
  • Weight: 40 g (1.4 oz) (without packaging) 
  • Handle Material: TC4/Grade 5 Titanium 
  • Blade Material: Crucible S35VN Stainless Steel

Sleek design

 

Precision is key

It all started with an idea - to create the best micro blade possible. A design that is small enough to be attached to your keys, and still effective for everyday tasks when you need it. We went through 3 prototypes, adding functions and making improvements each step of the way, to present you with the best version of Black Panther. 

It took us months of iteration and hard work to get us where we are today.

Research & Development

 

We chose Crucible S35VN stainless steel despite its high cost, to ensure Black Panther can handle all kinds of tasks that you may throw at it.

As Knife Informer states in Guide to the Best Knife Steel - “you would struggle to find any steel with better edge retention, toughness and stain resistance for the money.”

S35VN steel is also the superior version of S30V steel, which "was designed in the US and is typically used for the high-end premium pocket knives and expensive kitchen cutlery.” Unlike other knives with 440C or AUS8 steel, we wanted to use the best stainless steel we can afford to construct Black Panther.

 

Don't need a knife? You can pledge $1 or other amounts to support us.

You can also gear up your Black Panther with accessory options - Leather keyring for convenient carry. Glass breaker + pocket clip for emergency escape.  

*Please note the glass breaker & pocket clip CANNOT be used with the leather keyring attached.

We all love options, so once we reach the $20,000 goal, you can choose to receive your Black Panther in Titanium Gray (although we love the original Midnight Black just as much).

Stretch Goal #2 - Titanium Gray

 

With the $10,000 goal, you'll receive your Black Panther in a gift box with microfiber pouch.

Stretch Goal #1 - Gift Box & Microfiber Pouch

We put a lot of attention to details and focus on added value, because we want you to be as delighted as we are when we finished our final prototype.

Versatile for all situations

Tungsten Carbide Glass Breaker & Deep Carry Pocket Clip

 

To receive an accessory option, simply add the following amount to your total pledge amount.

  • $5 Leather Keyring x1 ($8 value) 
  • $15 Tungsten Carbide Glass Breaker x1 & Deep Carry Pocket Clip x1 ($20 value)

$5 Leather Keyring

 

$15 Glass Breaker & Pocket Clip

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to see our efforts come to fruition? Here's what you can do:

SHARE this campaign, tell friends & family about our cool pocket knife. Help us get the word out, it really keeps us going and crank out more cool stuff for all of you! 

FOLLOW us on social media.

Every pledge and every share counts. Your support means a lot to us!

New friends and longtime supporters, thank you all for making the Black Panther campaign possible.

Contact us at support@smrtgadget.com for further questions and we'll get back to you ASAP.

Nico & SMRT

 

 

Risk & Challenges

The Black Panther is in its final stage of product development and we’re really excited to finally present our hard work to you. Production is lined up and ready to go, now all we need is YOUR HELP to push it through to mass production. Once this campaign is complete and funded, we can get the production going and begin shipping.

We’re working closely with the manufacturer to ensure that deadlines are met and rewards are delivered in a timely manner. However, if demand becomes overwhelmingly high and/or unforeseeable challenges occur, there may be some delays. Whenever that happens, we will keep you in the loop and do everything we can to achieve the best possible results.

 

FAQ

For those who have questions about Perks and How To Use Indiegogo, CLICK HERE. 

 

Do you offer worldwide delivery?

Yes, we do. Depending on your location the delivery time may vary from 2-4 weeks from your Perk's estimated delivery date. We will make sure to dispatch on time according to your chosen Perk, and will certainly keep you posted on updates.

How to sharpen my Black Panther knife?
Black Panther blade is made of S35VN steel and comes razor-sharp out of the box, and will remain sharp for a very long time. However, with intensive and regular use, you may need to resharpen the blade. Sharpening a curved edge is no different than with a straight edge, you just need to use a rounded sharpening stone. DMT rods are a great option among others.

Can the Black Panther Rust?

It is very unlikely, the blade of the Black Panther is made of American S35VN Stainless steel and offers a very high corrosion resistance. However, stainless does not mean “stain proof” and proper care is required to maintain your knife in top condition. Drying the knife before storing it is a good practice.

What is the warranty for the Black Panther knife?

We offer warranty towards any defects in material and workmanship. Damage caused by normal wear and tear, misuse or abuse of the Black Panther knife are not covered by this guarantee.

Is the Back Panther knife legal in my country?

Black Panther’s 1.6 inches blade is legal in most places. But laws and regulations are different in every country. To avoid issues upon receiving Perks, we strongly recommend and encourage our backers to check with their local authorities and customs before backing. It is the recipient’s responsibility to not infringe the law by importing and/or carrying this knife.

The item may also be subject to import taxes depending on your location. Recipients are responsible for the fees and taxes that occur at local customs.

We cannot guarantee the speed of customs clearance, but with the help of our fulfillment partner, we will do our best to have your shipment delivered as smoothly as possible.

Other main features we get asked about - 

High flat grind - Starting from the center of the blade, to maintain thickness and strength on the spine.  

Glass breaker & pocket clip - the glass breaker screws into the spacer and secures the pocket clip. The pocket clip can be positioned on either side of the knife. The base of glass breaker will be hexagonal on the final version, making it easier to secure in place.

 

Still got questions? Contact us at support@smrtgadget.com and we'll get back to you ASAP.
story_txt:
Press & editorial inquiries, click here for more informationor contact us pr@smrtgadget.comStretch Goal #2 Titanium Gray - Back us NOW to receive yours in this exclusive color  For those who have questions about Perks and How To Use Indiegogo, CLICK HERE.  Nico Nikolic, with an addiction for beautiful sharp objects from a young age, is a professional photographer turned designer. By combining his experience from the French military and his passion for the outdoors, Nico has created the best value micro blade that EDC fans can dream of.As a longtime enthusiast in the pocket knife community, Nico spent a lot of time understanding what makes a design functional and timeless.Black Panther is designed with functionality in mind, making light work of the toughest tasks. From starting fires, cutting boxes and cords, to escaping from windows in an emergency, we’ve engineered every part of this micro blade to be versatile in all situations.Press & editorial inquiries, click here for more informationor contact us pr@smrtgadget.comWhat can this small knife be used for? We thought you'd never ask. Integrating Black Panther's built-in features with accessory options, the possibilities are endless. Here are just a few examples, and the list just goes on... 
Fire Starter A common misconception is striking a firesteel rod with the cutting side of the blade. Doing so damages your blade, and it's not necessary when we know you put in time and effort for blade maintenance. We've designed a notch on the back of the blade, specifically for striking firesteel rods. The notch fits most rods, and it allows you to start fires easily, without damaging the blade.    Bottle Opener Who doesn't like opening a bottle like a badass?
   Cutting & Carving The hawkbill blade design "grabs" onto whatever it's cutting. The result? You don't have to apply too much force, a little force goes a long way, and cuts smooth like a hot knife through butter.        Emergency Escape (with Glass Breaker)"The best camera is the one you have with you."We hope you never have to be in an emergency situation like this, but it's important to have the necessary tool when things happen.    Stealth Carry (with Pocket Clip)Whether you're in the midst of urban jungle or out in the wild, Black Panther has you covered. You can use it to process wood, start a fire, break out of an emergency situation, open a beer bottle, or cut just about anything for daily tasks.We like things that are practical, and when they come in style? Even better.​​      Compact design for convenience Speaking of style, here's more -Stretch Goal #2 - Titanium GrayStretch Goal #2 - Titanium GrayStretch Goal #2 - Titanium Gray  Press & editorial inquiries, click here for more informationor contact us pr@smrtgadget.comWe've engineered Black Panther with useful features and durability, every part of the blade was designed with functionality in mind. 
Blade Length: 4 cm (1.6 inches)   
Closed Length: 6.6 cm (2.6 inches) 
Open Length: 10.6 cm (4.2 inches) 
Blade Thickness: 2.8 mm (0.11 inches)
Weight: 40 g (1.4 oz) (without packaging) 
Handle Material: TC4/Grade 5 Titanium 
Blade Material: Crucible S35VN Stainless Steel
Sleek design Precision is keyIt all started with an idea - to create the best micro blade possible. A design that is small enough to be attached to your keys, and still effective for everyday tasks when you need it. We went through 3 prototypes, adding functions and making improvements each step of the way, to present you with the best version of Black Panther. It took us months of iteration and hard work to get us where we are today.Research & Development We chose Crucible S35VN stainless steel despite its high cost, to ensure Black Panther can handle all kinds of tasks that you may throw at it.As Knife Informer states in Guide to the Best Knife Steel - “you would struggle to find any steel with better edge retention, toughness and stain resistance for the money.”S35VN steel is also the superior version of S30V steel, which "was designed in the US and is typically used for the high-end premium pocket knives and expensive kitchen cutlery.” Unlike other knives with 440C or AUS8 steel, we wanted to use the best stainless steel we can afford to construct Black Panther. Don't need a knife? You can pledge $1 or other amounts to support us.You can also gear up your Black Panther with accessory options - Leather keyring for convenient carry. Glass breaker + pocket clip for emergency escape.  *Please note the glass breaker & pocket clip CANNOT be used with the leather keyring attached.We all love options, so once we reach the $20,000 goal, you can choose to receive your Black Panther in Titanium Gray (although we love the original Midnight Black just as much).Stretch Goal #2 - Titanium Gray With the $10,000 goal, you'll receive your Black Panther in a gift box with microfiber pouch.Stretch Goal #1 - Gift Box & Microfiber PouchWe put a lot of attention to details and focus on added value, because we want you to be as delighted as we are when we finished our final prototype.Versatile for all situationsTungsten Carbide Glass Breaker & Deep Carry Pocket Clip To receive an accessory option, simply add the following amount to your total pledge amount.
$5 Leather Keyring x1 ($8 value) 
$15 Tungsten Carbide Glass Breaker x1 & Deep Carry Pocket Clip x1 ($20 value)
$5 Leather Keyring $15 Glass Breaker & Pocket Clip Other Ways You Can HelpWant to see our efforts come to fruition? Here's what you can do:SHARE this campaign, tell friends & family about our cool pocket knife. Help us get the word out, it really keeps us going and crank out more cool stuff for all of you! FOLLOW us on social media.Every pledge and every share counts. Your support means a lot to us!New friends and longtime supporters, thank you all for making the Black Panther campaign possible.Contact us at support@smrtgadget.com for further questions and we'll get back to you ASAP.Nico & SMRT   Risk & ChallengesThe Black Panther is in its final stage of product development and we’re really excited to finally present our hard work to you. Production is lined up and ready to go, now all we need is YOUR HELP to push it through to mass production. Once this campaign is complete and funded, we can get the production going and begin shipping.We’re working closely with the manufacturer to ensure that deadlines are met and rewards are delivered in a timely manner. However, if demand becomes overwhelmingly high and/or unforeseeable challenges occur, there may be some delays. Whenever that happens, we will keep you in the loop and do everything we can to achieve the best possible results. FAQFor those who have questions about Perks and How To Use Indiegogo, CLICK HERE.  Do you offer worldwide delivery?Yes, we do. Depending on your location the delivery time may vary from 2-4 weeks from your Perk's estimated delivery date. We will make sure to dispatch on time according to your chosen Perk, and will certainly keep you posted on updates.How to sharpen my Black Panther knife?Black Panther blade is made of S35VN steel and comes razor-sharp out of the box, and will remain sharp for a very long time. However, with intensive and regular use, you may need to resharpen the blade. Sharpening a curved edge is no different than with a straight edge, you just need to use a rounded sharpening stone. DMT rods are a great option among others.Can the Black Panther Rust?It is very unlikely, the blade of the Black Panther is made of American S35VN Stainless steel and offers a very high corrosion resistance. However, stainless does not mean “stain proof” and proper care is required to maintain your knife in top condition. Drying the knife before storing it is a good practice.What is the warranty for the Black Panther knife?We offer warranty towards any defects in material and workmanship. Damage caused by normal wear and tear, misuse or abuse of the Black Panther knife are not covered by this guarantee.Is the Back Panther knife legal in my country?Black Panther’s 1.6 inches blade is legal in most places. But laws and regulations are different in every country. To avoid issues upon receiving Perks, we strongly recommend and encourage our backers to check with their local authorities and customs before backing. It is the recipient’s responsibility to not infringe the law by importing and/or carrying this knife.The item may also be subject to import taxes depending on your location. Recipients are responsible for the fees and taxes that occur at local customs.We cannot guarantee the speed of customs clearance, but with the help of our fulfillment partner, we will do our best to have your shipment delivered as smoothly as possible.Other main features we get asked about - High flat grind - Starting from the center of the blade, to maintain thickness and strength on the spine.  Glass breaker & pocket clip - the glass breaker screws into the spacer and secures the pocket clip. The pocket clip can be positioned on either side of the knife. The base of glass breaker will be hexagonal on the final version, making it easier to secure in place. Still got questions? Contact us at support@smrtgadget.com and we'll get back to you ASAP.

story:
This is my friend Zach

Zach lives in Breckenridge and loves the outdoors. He is a hardworking educated American.

He worked his butt off all year and rewarded himself with a new mountain bike for the summer.

It was a very nice Trek mountain bike and he lives in one of the best areas in the US for off road biking.

He loved his bike and showed it to everyone who would take a look.

One night last week a stranger in the neighborhood was taking a look without permission and decided they loved it too....


Zach needs a new mountain bike

  • If you only knew the joy that comes to this guy from riding his bike in the beautiful Rocky Mountains every day
  • When I heard that someone had stolen it I knew he must be heart broken
  • So I decided to help out the best way I know how
  • I am hoping to rally the support of any mountain bike/outdoor enthusiasts, friends, family, and just all sympathizers who have ever had a very special possession taken from them


Please find it in your heart to show Zach that despite being burglarized, there are still good people in the world

Can't make a contribution right now?
That's fine. Perhaps you could just share this page on your Facebook or elsewhere on the web or with anyone who has ever been in the same shoes as my friend.
I will document the entire purchase of the new bike and giving it to Zach so that you are confident your contribution was only applied towards righting this wrong and nothing else. I sincerely thank all of you for your contributions.

story:
Short Summary

The Dayton Informer seeks to raise $3,000 in order to pay for 100 reports from the various City Boards of the City of Dayton, which go virtually uncovered in the local media. A list of these various boards and their members can be found at:

http://www.cityofdayton.org/cco/Pages/CityBoards.aspx

Boards such as the Port Authority, The Board of Zoning Appeals, Landmark Commission, go completely unchecked by Dayton's media. However, these boards often yield considerable power and spending ability.

While this kind of journalism is not the sexiest, it is among the most important kind that a media outlet can provide a community. The Dayton Informer City Board Coverage Fund will help to assure that all Daytonians are better informed about the inner-workings and personalities of their government.

What We Need

We need $3,000 to fund 100 reports, at which time we will launch new fundraisers such as a benefit concert, or other means to help fund our project. If our goal is not reached, we will use whatever funds that are donated to fund as many reports as we can.

The Impact

With coverage of The City of Dayton's many boards, Daytonians will be able to be much more informed about who, how and why your tax dollars are being spent, and get a much better look into the inside structure of The City of Dayton which currently goes uncovered by local media, but which impact the lives of all Daytonians.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that in this tough economy, not everyone can help monetarily. However, something as simple as sharing this campaign with your friends helps tremendously in achiveing our goal.

story:
Dot Bike

Dot Bike is a group of committed residents in Dorchester, MA who are working together to make our neighborhood more bike-friendly.  We are pleased to be partnering with VietAID on this project.  Their mission is to build a strong community and transform Fields Corner into a vibrant, diverse neighborhood. 

Both of our organizations want to make bike repair more accessible in Dorchester, Boston's largest and most diverse neighborhood.  Our current initiative is to purchase and install a publicly accessible Dero Fixit with Air Kit 3 Pump, so community members have access to tools to help them get on the road and ride safely.  This will be the first such Fixit in this part of Dorchester!  Similar stations already exist in other neighborhoods.

What We Need & What You Get 

  • The $2,000 you help us raise this summer will enable us to purchase and install the  Dero Fixit with Air Kit 3 Pump, plus a Pump Stop unit to hold your bike upright while you use the pump.
  • Contributors of $50+ will receive an invitation to the ribbon-cutting event and a DotBike T-shirt.
  • Contributors of $25+ will receive an invitation to the ribbon-cutting event.
  • You will be able to utilize this community resource and let others know that you helped make it happen.

The Impact

Dorchester has very few publicly accessible bike repair stations.  

  • We want more people to bike in Dorchester.  Having free access to tools to fix a flat tire or adjust your brakes will help remove some barriers to biking.
  • Once the Fixit is installed, we plan to work with local groups and businesses to lead bike repair tutorials on-site so that people know how to use the Fixit.
  • If we exceed our target amount for this initiative, we will put funds toward another Fixit. Dorchester is a big place and it would be great to have several Fixits throughout our part of the city.

Risks & Challenges

Once the bike fix-it station is purchased and installed, we need to take care of it so it serves its purpose for years to come.

  • The Fixit station will be located outside a VietAID property in the Fields Corner neighborhood and the organization will keep an eye on the station.
  • We are going to need to work together to ensure that the Fixit station is maintained.  We have members who have volunteered to keep the Fixit station in good working order.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to friends.
  • Like Dot Bike on Facebook.
